346 /*
347  These are fields that can be gathered from IDevice and IAudioDevice PRIOR to Initialize, and
348  done in first pass i assume that neither of these will cause the Driver to "load", but again,
349  who knows how they implement their stuff
350  */
351 typedef struct PaWasapiDeviceInfo
352 {
353  // Device
354  IMMDevice *device;
355 
356  // from GetId
357  WCHAR szDeviceID[MAX_STR_LEN];
358 
359  // from GetState
360  DWORD state;
361 
362  // Fields filled from IMMEndpoint'sGetDataFlow
363  EDataFlow flow;
364 
365  // Fields filled from IAudioDevice (_prior_ to Initialize)
366  // from GetDevicePeriod(
367  REFERENCE_TIME DefaultDevicePeriod;
368  REFERENCE_TIME MinimumDevicePeriod;
369 
370  // from GetMixFormat
371  // WAVEFORMATEX *MixFormat;//needs to be CoTaskMemFree'd after use!
372 
373  // Default format (setup through Control Panel by user)
374  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE DefaultFormat;
375 
376  // Formfactor
377  EndpointFormFactor formFactor;
378 
379  // Loopback indicator
380  int loopBack;
381 }
382 PaWasapiDeviceInfo;

552 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
553 #define LogHostError(HRES) __LogHostError(HRES, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, __LINE__)
554 static HRESULT __LogHostError(HRESULT res, const char *func, const char *file, int line)
555 {
556  const char *text = NULL;
557  switch (res)
558  {
559  case S_OK: return res;
560  case E_POINTER :text ="E_POINTER"; break;
561  case E_INVALIDARG :text ="E_INVALIDARG"; break;
562 
563  case AUDCLNT_E_NOT_INITIALIZED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_NOT_INITIALIZED"; break;
564  case AUDCLNT_E_ALREADY_INITIALIZED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_ALREADY_INITIALIZED"; break;
565  case AUDCLNT_E_WRONG_ENDPOINT_TYPE :text ="AUDCLNT_E_WRONG_ENDPOINT_TYPE"; break;
566  case AUDCLNT_E_DEVICE_INVALIDATED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_DEVICE_INVALIDATED"; break;
567  case AUDCLNT_E_NOT_STOPPED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_NOT_STOPPED"; break;
568  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE"; break;
569  case AUDCLNT_E_OUT_OF_ORDER :text ="AUDCLNT_E_OUT_OF_ORDER"; break;
570  case AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT :text ="AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT"; break;
571  case AUDCLNT_E_INVALID_SIZE :text ="AUDCLNT_E_INVALID_SIZE"; break;
572  case AUDCLNT_E_DEVICE_IN_USE :text ="AUDCLNT_E_DEVICE_IN_USE"; break;
573  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_OPERATION_PENDING :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_OPERATION_PENDING"; break;
574  case AUDCLNT_E_THREAD_NOT_REGISTERED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_THREAD_NOT_REGISTERED"; break;
575  case AUDCLNT_E_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED"; break;
576  case AUDCLNT_E_ENDPOINT_CREATE_FAILED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_ENDPOINT_CREATE_FAILED"; break;
577  case AUDCLNT_E_SERVICE_NOT_RUNNING :text ="AUDCLNT_E_SERVICE_NOT_RUNNING"; break;
578  case AUDCLNT_E_EVENTHANDLE_NOT_EXPECTED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_EVENTHANDLE_NOT_EXPECTED"; break;
579  case AUDCLNT_E_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_ONLY :text ="AUDCLNT_E_EXCLUSIVE_MODE_ONLY"; break;
580  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFDURATION_PERIOD_NOT_EQUAL :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFDURATION_PERIOD_NOT_EQUAL"; break;
581  case AUDCLNT_E_EVENTHANDLE_NOT_SET :text ="AUDCLNT_E_EVENTHANDLE_NOT_SET"; break;
582  case AUDCLNT_E_INCORRECT_BUFFER_SIZE :text ="AUDCLNT_E_INCORRECT_BUFFER_SIZE"; break;
583  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_ERROR :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_ERROR"; break;
584  case AUDCLNT_E_CPUUSAGE_EXCEEDED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_CPUUSAGE_EXCEEDED"; break;
585  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_ERROR :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_ERROR"; break;
586  case AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_NOT_ALIGNED :text ="AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_NOT_ALIGNED"; break;
587  case AUDCLNT_E_INVALID_DEVICE_PERIOD :text ="AUDCLNT_E_INVALID_DEVICE_PERIOD"; break;
588 
589  case AUDCLNT_S_BUFFER_EMPTY :text ="AUDCLNT_S_BUFFER_EMPTY"; break;
590  case AUDCLNT_S_THREAD_ALREADY_REGISTERED :text ="AUDCLNT_S_THREAD_ALREADY_REGISTERED"; break;
591  case AUDCLNT_S_POSITION_STALLED :text ="AUDCLNT_S_POSITION_STALLED"; break;
592 
593  // other windows common errors:
594  case CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED :text ="CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED: you must call CoInitialize() before Pa_OpenStream()"; break;
595 
596  default:
597  text = "UNKNOWN ERROR";
598  }
599  PRINT(("WASAPI ERROR HRESULT: 0x%X : %s\n [FUNCTION: %s FILE: %s {LINE: %d}]\n", res, text, func, file, line));
600  PA_SKELETON_SET_LAST_HOST_ERROR(res, text);
601  return res;
602 }

604 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
605 #define LogPaError(PAERR) __LogPaError(PAERR, __FUNCTION__, __FILE__, __LINE__)
606 static PaError __LogPaError(PaError err, const char *func, const char *file, int line)
607 {
608  if (err == paNoError)
609  return err;
610  PRINT(("WASAPI ERROR PAERROR: %i : %s\n [FUNCTION: %s FILE: %s {LINE: %d}]\n", err, Pa_GetErrorText(err), func, file, line));
611  return err;
612 }

614 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
621 typedef struct ThreadIdleScheduler
622 {
623  UINT32 m_idle_microseconds;
624  UINT32 m_next_sleep;
625  UINT32 m_i;
626  UINT32 m_resolution;
627 }
628 ThreadIdleScheduler;
630 static void ThreadIdleScheduler_Setup(ThreadIdleScheduler *sched, UINT32 resolution, UINT32 microseconds)
631 {
632  assert(microseconds != 0);
633  assert(resolution != 0);
634  assert((resolution * 1000) >= microseconds);
635 
636  memset(sched, 0, sizeof(*sched));
637 
638  sched->m_idle_microseconds = microseconds;
639  sched->m_resolution = resolution;
640  sched->m_next_sleep = (resolution * 1000) / microseconds;
641 }
643 static UINT32 ThreadIdleScheduler_NextSleep(ThreadIdleScheduler *sched)
644 {
645  // advance and check if thread can sleep
646  if (++ sched->m_i == sched->m_next_sleep)
647  {
648  sched->m_i = 0;
649  return sched->m_resolution;
650  }
651  return 0;
652 }

690 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
691 // Makes Hns period from frames and sample rate
692 static REFERENCE_TIME MakeHnsPeriod(UINT32 nFrames, DWORD nSamplesPerSec)
693 {
694  return (REFERENCE_TIME)((10000.0 * 1000 / nSamplesPerSec * nFrames) + 0.5);
695 }

697 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
698 // Converts PaSampleFormat to bits per sample value
699 static WORD PaSampleFormatToBitsPerSample(PaSampleFormat format_id)
700 {
701  switch (format_id & ~paNonInterleaved)
702  {
703  case paFloat32:
704  case paInt32: return 32;
705  case paInt24: return 24;
706  case paInt16: return 16;
707  case paInt8:
708  case paUInt8: return 8;
709  }
710  return 0;
711 }

720 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
721 // Converts Hns period into number of frames
722 static UINT32 MakeFramesFromHns(REFERENCE_TIME hnsPeriod, UINT32 nSamplesPerSec)
723 {
724  UINT32 nFrames = (UINT32)( // frames =
725  1.0 * hnsPeriod * // hns *
726  nSamplesPerSec / // (frames / s) /
727  1000 / // (ms / s) /
728  10000 // (hns / s) /
729  + 0.5 // rounding
730  );
731  return nFrames;
732 }
733 
734 // Aligning function type
735 typedef UINT32 (*ALIGN_FUNC) (UINT32 v, UINT32 align);
736 
737 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
738 // Aligns 'v' backwards
739 static UINT32 ALIGN_BWD(UINT32 v, UINT32 align)
740 {
741  return ((v - (align ? v % align : 0)));
742 }
743 
744 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
745 // Aligns 'v' forward
746 static UINT32 ALIGN_FWD(UINT32 v, UINT32 align)
747 {
748  UINT32 remainder = (align ? (v % align) : 0);
749  if (remainder == 0)
750  return v;
751  return v + (align - remainder);
752 }
753 
754 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
755 // Get next value power of 2
756 UINT32 ALIGN_NEXT_POW2(UINT32 v)
757 {
758  UINT32 v2 = 1;
759  while (v > (v2 <<= 1)) { }
760  v = v2;
761  return v;
762 }
763 
764 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
765 // Aligns WASAPI buffer to 128 byte packet boundary. HD Audio will fail to play if buffer
766 // is misaligned. This problem was solved in Windows 7 were AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_NOT_ALIGNED
767 // is thrown although we must align for Vista anyway.
768 static UINT32 AlignFramesPerBuffer(UINT32 nFrames, UINT32 nSamplesPerSec, UINT32 nBlockAlign,
769  ALIGN_FUNC pAlignFunc)
770 {
771 #define HDA_PACKET_SIZE (128)
772 
773  long frame_bytes = nFrames * nBlockAlign;
774  long packets;
775 
776  // align to packet size
777  frame_bytes = pAlignFunc(frame_bytes, HDA_PACKET_SIZE); // use ALIGN_FWD if bigger but safer period is more desired
778 
779  // atlest 1 frame must be available
780  if (frame_bytes < HDA_PACKET_SIZE)
781  frame_bytes = HDA_PACKET_SIZE;
782 
783  nFrames = frame_bytes / nBlockAlign;
784  packets = frame_bytes / HDA_PACKET_SIZE;
785 
786  frame_bytes = packets * HDA_PACKET_SIZE;
787  nFrames = frame_bytes / nBlockAlign;
788 
789  return nFrames;
790 
791 #undef HDA_PACKET_SIZE
792 }
793 
794 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
795 static UINT32 GetFramesSleepTime(UINT32 nFrames, UINT32 nSamplesPerSec)
796 {
797  REFERENCE_TIME nDuration;
798  if (nSamplesPerSec == 0)
799  return 0;
800 #define REFTIMES_PER_SEC 10000000
801 #define REFTIMES_PER_MILLISEC 10000
802  // Calculate the actual duration of the allocated buffer.
803  nDuration = (REFERENCE_TIME)((double)REFTIMES_PER_SEC * nFrames / nSamplesPerSec);
804  return (UINT32)(nDuration/REFTIMES_PER_MILLISEC/2);
805 }
806 
807 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
808 static UINT32 GetFramesSleepTimeMicroseconds(UINT32 nFrames, UINT32 nSamplesPerSec)
809 {
810  REFERENCE_TIME nDuration;
811  if (nSamplesPerSec == 0)
812  return 0;
813 #define REFTIMES_PER_SEC 10000000
814 #define REFTIMES_PER_MILLISEC 10000
815  // Calculate the actual duration of the allocated buffer.
816  nDuration = (REFERENCE_TIME)((double)REFTIMES_PER_SEC * nFrames / nSamplesPerSec);
817  return (UINT32)(nDuration/10/2);
818 }

822 {
823  hDInputDLL = LoadLibraryA("avrt.dll");
824  if (hDInputDLL == NULL)
825  return FALSE;
826 
827  _GetProc(pAvRtCreateThreadOrderingGroup, FAvRtCreateThreadOrderingGroup, "AvRtCreateThreadOrderingGroup");
828  _GetProc(pAvRtDeleteThreadOrderingGroup, FAvRtDeleteThreadOrderingGroup, "AvRtDeleteThreadOrderingGroup");
829  _GetProc(pAvRtWaitOnThreadOrderingGroup, FAvRtWaitOnThreadOrderingGroup, "AvRtWaitOnThreadOrderingGroup");
830  _GetProc(pAvSetMmThreadCharacteristics, FAvSetMmThreadCharacteristics, "AvSetMmThreadCharacteristicsA");
831  _GetProc(pAvRevertMmThreadCharacteristics,FAvRevertMmThreadCharacteristics,"AvRevertMmThreadCharacteristics");
832  _GetProc(pAvSetMmThreadPriority, FAvSetMmThreadPriority, "AvSetMmThreadPriority");
833 
834  return pAvRtCreateThreadOrderingGroup &&
835  pAvRtDeleteThreadOrderingGroup &&
836  pAvRtWaitOnThreadOrderingGroup &&
837  pAvSetMmThreadCharacteristics &&
838  pAvRevertMmThreadCharacteristics &&
839  pAvSetMmThreadPriority;
840 }

850 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
851 static BOOL IsWow64()
852 {
853  // http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms684139(VS.85).aspx
854 
855  typedef BOOL (WINAPI *LPFN_ISWOW64PROCESS) (HANDLE, PBOOL);
856  LPFN_ISWOW64PROCESS fnIsWow64Process;
857 
858  BOOL bIsWow64 = FALSE;
859 
860  // IsWow64Process is not available on all supported versions of Windows.
861  // Use GetModuleHandle to get a handle to the DLL that contains the function
862  // and GetProcAddress to get a pointer to the function if available.
863 
864  fnIsWow64Process = (LPFN_ISWOW64PROCESS) GetProcAddress(
865  GetModuleHandleA("kernel32"), "IsWow64Process");
866 
867  if (fnIsWow64Process == NULL)
868  return FALSE;
869 
870  if (!fnIsWow64Process(GetCurrentProcess(), &bIsWow64))
871  return FALSE;
872 
873  return bIsWow64;
874 }

876 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
877 typedef enum EWindowsVersion
878 {
879  WINDOWS_UNKNOWN = 0,
880  WINDOWS_VISTA_SERVER2008,
881  WINDOWS_7_SERVER2008R2,
882  WINDOWS_8_SERVER2012,
883  WINDOWS_8_1_SERVER2012R2,
884  WINDOWS_10_SERVER2016,
885  WINDOWS_FUTURE
886 }
887 EWindowsVersion;
888 // Alternative way for checking Windows version (allows to check version on Windows 8.1 and up)
889 static BOOL IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(WORD wMajorVersion, WORD wMinorVersion, WORD wServicePackMajor)
890 {
891  typedef ULONGLONG (NTAPI *LPFN_VERSETCONDITIONMASK)(ULONGLONG ConditionMask, DWORD TypeMask, BYTE Condition);
892  typedef BOOL (WINAPI *LPFN_VERIFYVERSIONINFO)(LPOSVERSIONINFOEXA lpVersionInformation, DWORD dwTypeMask, DWORDLONG dwlConditionMask);
893 
894  LPFN_VERSETCONDITIONMASK fnVerSetConditionMask;
895  LPFN_VERIFYVERSIONINFO fnVerifyVersionInfo;
896  OSVERSIONINFOEXA osvi = { sizeof(osvi), 0, 0, 0, 0, {0}, 0, 0 };
897  DWORDLONG dwlConditionMask;
898 
899  fnVerSetConditionMask = (LPFN_VERSETCONDITIONMASK)GetProcAddress(GetModuleHandleA("kernel32"), "VerSetConditionMask");
900  fnVerifyVersionInfo = (LPFN_VERIFYVERSIONINFO)GetProcAddress(GetModuleHandleA("kernel32"), "VerifyVersionInfoA");
901 
902  if ((fnVerSetConditionMask == NULL) || (fnVerifyVersionInfo == NULL))
903  return FALSE;
904 
905  dwlConditionMask = fnVerSetConditionMask(
906  fnVerSetConditionMask(
907  fnVerSetConditionMask(
908  0, VER_MAJORVERSION, VER_GREATER_EQUAL),
909  VER_MINORVERSION, VER_GREATER_EQUAL),
910  VER_SERVICEPACKMAJOR, VER_GREATER_EQUAL);
911 
912  osvi.dwMajorVersion = wMajorVersion;
913  osvi.dwMinorVersion = wMinorVersion;
914  osvi.wServicePackMajor = wServicePackMajor;
915 
916  return (fnVerifyVersionInfo(&osvi, VER_MAJORVERSION | VER_MINORVERSION | VER_SERVICEPACKMAJOR, dwlConditionMask) != FALSE);
917 }
918 // Get Windows version
919 static EWindowsVersion GetWindowsVersion()
920 {
921  static EWindowsVersion version = WINDOWS_UNKNOWN;
922 
923  if (version == WINDOWS_UNKNOWN)
924  {
925  DWORD dwVersion = 0;
926  DWORD dwMajorVersion = 0;
927  DWORD dwMinorVersion = 0;
928  DWORD dwBuild = 0;
929 
930  typedef DWORD (WINAPI *LPFN_GETVERSION)(VOID);
931  LPFN_GETVERSION fnGetVersion;
932 
933  fnGetVersion = (LPFN_GETVERSION)GetProcAddress(GetModuleHandleA("kernel32"), "GetVersion");
934  if (fnGetVersion != NULL)
935  {
936  PRINT(("WASAPI: getting Windows version with GetVersion()\n"));
937 
938  dwVersion = fnGetVersion();
939 
940  // Get the Windows version
941  dwMajorVersion = (DWORD)(LOBYTE(LOWORD(dwVersion)));
942  dwMinorVersion = (DWORD)(HIBYTE(LOWORD(dwVersion)));
943 
944  // Get the build number
945  if (dwVersion < 0x80000000)
946  dwBuild = (DWORD)(HIWORD(dwVersion));
947 
948  switch (dwMajorVersion)
949  {
950  case 0:
951  case 1:
952  case 2:
953  case 3:
954  case 4:
955  case 5:
956  break; // skip lower
957  case 6:
958  switch (dwMinorVersion)
959  {
960  case 0: version = WINDOWS_VISTA_SERVER2008; break;
961  case 1: version = WINDOWS_7_SERVER2008R2; break;
962  case 2: version = WINDOWS_8_SERVER2012; break;
963  case 3: version = WINDOWS_8_1_SERVER2012R2; break;
964  default: version = WINDOWS_FUTURE; break;
965  }
966  break;
967  case 10:
968  switch (dwMinorVersion)
969  {
970  case 0: version = WINDOWS_10_SERVER2016; break;
971  default: version = WINDOWS_FUTURE; break;
972  }
973  break;
974  default:
975  version = WINDOWS_FUTURE;
976  break;
977  }
978  }
979  else
980  {
981  PRINT(("WASAPI: getting Windows version with VerifyVersionInfo()\n"));
982 
983  if (IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(10, 0, 0))
984  version = WINDOWS_10_SERVER2016;
985  else
986  if (IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(6, 3, 0))
987  version = WINDOWS_8_1_SERVER2012R2;
988  else
989  if (IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(6, 2, 0))
990  version = WINDOWS_8_SERVER2012;
991  else
992  if (IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(6, 1, 0))
993  version = WINDOWS_7_SERVER2008R2;
994  else
995  if (IsWindowsVersionOrGreater(6, 0, 0))
996  version = WINDOWS_VISTA_SERVER2008;
997  else
998  version = WINDOWS_FUTURE;
999  }
1000 
1001  PRINT(("WASAPI: Windows version = %d\n", version));
1002  }
1003 
1004  return version;
1005 }
1006 
1007 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1008 static BOOL UseWOW64Workaround()
1009 {
1010  // note: WOW64 bug is common to Windows Vista x64, thus we fall back to safe Poll-driven
1011  // method. Windows 7 x64 seems has WOW64 bug fixed.
1012 
1013  return (IsWow64() && (GetWindowsVersion() == WINDOWS_VISTA_SERVER2008));
1014 }

1016 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1017 static UINT32 GetAudioClientVersion()
1018 {
1019  if (GetWindowsVersion() >= WINDOWS_10_SERVER2016)
1020  return 3;
1021  else
1022  if (GetWindowsVersion() >= WINDOWS_8_SERVER2012)
1023  return 2;
1024 
1025  return 1;
1026 }

1028 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1029 static const IID *GetAudioClientIID()
1030 {
1031  static const IID *cli_iid = NULL;
1032  if (cli_iid == NULL)
1033  {
1034  UINT32 cli_version = GetAudioClientVersion();
1035  if (cli_version <= 1)
1036  {
1037  cli_iid = &pa_IID_IAudioClient;
1038  }
1039  else
1040  {
1041  switch (cli_version)
1042  {
1043  case 3: cli_iid = &pa_IID_IAudioClient2; cli_version = 2; break; // use IAudioClient2 for Windows 10+ until IAudioClient3 functions are required
1044  default: cli_iid = &pa_IID_IAudioClient2; cli_version = 2; break;
1045  }
1046  }
1047 
1048  PRINT(("WASAPI: IAudioClient version = %d\n", cli_version));
1049  }
1050 
1051  return cli_iid;
1052 }

1055 typedef enum EMixerDir { MIX_DIR__1TO2, MIX_DIR__2TO1, MIX_DIR__2TO1_L } EMixerDir;

1057 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1058 #define _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_1_TO_2(TYPE)\
1059  TYPE * __restrict to = __to;\
1060  TYPE * __restrict from = __from;\
1061  TYPE * __restrict end = from + count;\
1062  while (from != end)\
1063  {\
1064  *to ++ = *from;\
1065  *to ++ = *from;\
1066  ++ from;\
1067  }
1068 
1069 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1070 #define _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_FLT32(TYPE)\
1071  TYPE * __restrict to = (TYPE *)__to;\
1072  TYPE * __restrict from = (TYPE *)__from;\
1073  TYPE * __restrict end = to + count;\
1074  while (to != end)\
1075  {\
1076  *to ++ = (TYPE)((float)(from[0] + from[1]) * 0.5f);\
1077  from += 2;\
1078  }
1079 
1080 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1081 #define _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_INT32(TYPE)\
1082  TYPE * __restrict to = (TYPE *)__to;\
1083  TYPE * __restrict from = (TYPE *)__from;\
1084  TYPE * __restrict end = to + count;\
1085  while (to != end)\
1086  {\
1087  *to ++ = (TYPE)(((INT32)from[0] + (INT32)from[1]) >> 1);\
1088  from += 2;\
1089  }
1090 
1091 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1092 #define _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_INT64(TYPE)\
1093  TYPE * __restrict to = (TYPE *)__to;\
1094  TYPE * __restrict from = (TYPE *)__from;\
1095  TYPE * __restrict end = to + count;\
1096  while (to != end)\
1097  {\
1098  *to ++ = (TYPE)(((INT64)from[0] + (INT64)from[1]) >> 1);\
1099  from += 2;\
1100  }
1101 
1102 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1103 #define _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(TYPE)\
1104  TYPE * __restrict to = (TYPE *)__to;\
1105  TYPE * __restrict from = (TYPE *)__from;\
1106  TYPE * __restrict end = to + count;\
1107  while (to != end)\
1108  {\
1109  *to ++ = from[0];\
1110  from += 2;\
1111  }

1123 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_24(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_INT32(int); /* !!! int24 data is contained in 32-bit containers*/ }
1124 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_INT64(int); }
1125 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32f(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_FLT32(float); }
1126 
1127 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1128 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_8_L(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(BYTE); }
1129 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_16_L(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(short); }
1130 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_24_L(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(int); /* !!! int24 data is contained in 32-bit containers*/ }
1131 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32_L(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(int); }
1132 static void _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32f_L(void *__to, void *__from, UINT32 count) { _WASAPI_MONO_TO_STEREO_MIXER_2_TO_1_L(float); }
1133 
1134 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1135 static MixMonoToStereoF _GetMonoToStereoMixer(PaSampleFormat format, EMixerDir dir)
1136 {
1137  switch (dir)
1138  {
1139  case MIX_DIR__1TO2:
1140  switch (format & ~paNonInterleaved)
1141  {
1142  case paUInt8: return _MixMonoToStereo_1TO2_8;
1143  case paInt16: return _MixMonoToStereo_1TO2_16;
1144  case paInt24: return _MixMonoToStereo_1TO2_24;
1145  case paInt32: return _MixMonoToStereo_1TO2_32;
1146  case paFloat32: return _MixMonoToStereo_1TO2_32f;
1147  }
1148  break;
1149 
1150  case MIX_DIR__2TO1:
1151  switch (format & ~paNonInterleaved)
1152  {
1153  case paUInt8: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_8;
1154  case paInt16: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_16;
1155  case paInt24: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_24;
1156  case paInt32: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32;
1157  case paFloat32: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32f;
1158  }
1159  break;
1160 
1161  case MIX_DIR__2TO1_L:
1162  switch (format & ~paNonInterleaved)
1163  {
1164  case paUInt8: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_8_L;
1165  case paInt16: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_16_L;
1166  case paInt24: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_24_L;
1167  case paInt32: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32_L;
1168  case paFloat32: return _MixMonoToStereo_2TO1_32f_L;
1169  }
1170  break;
1171  }
1172 
1173  return NULL;
1174 }

1176 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1177 PaError PaWasapi_Initialize( PaUtilHostApiRepresentation **hostApi, PaHostApiIndex hostApiIndex )
1178 {
1179  PaError result = paNoError;
1180  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi;
1181  PaDeviceInfo *deviceInfoArray;
1182  HRESULT hr = S_OK;
1183  IMMDeviceCollection* pEndPoints = NULL;
1184  UINT i;
1185  UINT renderCount;
1186  UINT devIndex;
1187 
1188  if (!SetupAVRT())
1189  {
1190  PRINT(("WASAPI: No AVRT! (not VISTA?)"));
1191  return paNoError;
1192  }
1193 
1194  paWasapi = (PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *)PaUtil_AllocateMemory( sizeof(PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation) );
1195  if (paWasapi == NULL)
1196  {
1197  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1198  goto error;
1199  }
1200 
1201  memset( paWasapi, 0, sizeof(PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation) ); /* ensure all fields are zeroed. especially paWasapi->allocations */
1202 
1203  result = PaWinUtil_CoInitialize( paWASAPI, &paWasapi->comInitializationResult );
1204  if( result != paNoError )
1205  {
1206  goto error;
1207  }
1208 
1209  paWasapi->allocations = PaUtil_CreateAllocationGroup();
1210  if (paWasapi->allocations == NULL)
1211  {
1212  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1213  goto error;
1214  }
1215 
1216  *hostApi = &paWasapi->inheritedHostApiRep;
1217  (*hostApi)->info.structVersion = 1;
1218  (*hostApi)->info.type = paWASAPI;
1219  (*hostApi)->info.name = "Windows WASAPI";
1220  (*hostApi)->info.deviceCount = 0;
1221  (*hostApi)->info.defaultInputDevice = paNoDevice;
1222  (*hostApi)->info.defaultOutputDevice = paNoDevice;
1223 
1224  paWasapi->enumerator = NULL;
1225  hr = CoCreateInstance(&pa_CLSID_IMMDeviceEnumerator, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
1226  &pa_IID_IMMDeviceEnumerator, (void **)&paWasapi->enumerator);
1227 
1228  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1229  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1230  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1231 
1232  // getting default device ids in the eMultimedia "role"
1233  {
1234  {
1235  IMMDevice *defaultRenderer = NULL;
1236  hr = IMMDeviceEnumerator_GetDefaultAudioEndpoint(paWasapi->enumerator, eRender, eMultimedia, &defaultRenderer);
1237  if (hr != S_OK)
1238  {
1239  if (hr != E_NOTFOUND) {
1240  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1241  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1242  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1243  }
1244  }
1245  else
1246  {
1247  WCHAR *pszDeviceId = NULL;
1248  hr = IMMDevice_GetId(defaultRenderer, &pszDeviceId);
1249  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1250  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1251  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1252  wcsncpy(paWasapi->defaultRenderer, pszDeviceId, MAX_STR_LEN-1);
1253  CoTaskMemFree(pszDeviceId);
1254  IMMDevice_Release(defaultRenderer);
1255  }
1256  }
1257 
1258  {
1259  IMMDevice *defaultCapturer = NULL;
1260  hr = IMMDeviceEnumerator_GetDefaultAudioEndpoint(paWasapi->enumerator, eCapture, eMultimedia, &defaultCapturer);
1261  if (hr != S_OK)
1262  {
1263  if (hr != E_NOTFOUND) {
1264  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1265  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1266  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1267  }
1268  }
1269  else
1270  {
1271  WCHAR *pszDeviceId = NULL;
1272  hr = IMMDevice_GetId(defaultCapturer, &pszDeviceId);
1273  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1274  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1275  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1276  wcsncpy(paWasapi->defaultCapturer, pszDeviceId, MAX_STR_LEN-1);
1277  CoTaskMemFree(pszDeviceId);
1278  IMMDevice_Release(defaultCapturer);
1279  }
1280  }
1281  }
1282 
1283  hr = IMMDeviceEnumerator_EnumAudioEndpoints(paWasapi->enumerator, eRender, DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVE, &pEndPoints);
1284  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1285  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1286  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1287 
1288  hr = IMMDeviceCollection_GetCount(pEndPoints, &renderCount);
1289  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1290  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1291  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1292 
1293  SAFE_RELEASE(pEndPoints);
1294  pEndPoints = NULL;
1295 
1296  hr = IMMDeviceEnumerator_EnumAudioEndpoints(paWasapi->enumerator, eAll, DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVE, &pEndPoints);
1297  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1298  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1299  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1300 
1301  hr = IMMDeviceCollection_GetCount(pEndPoints, &paWasapi->deviceCount);
1302  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1303  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1304  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1305 
1306  paWasapi->deviceCount += renderCount;
1307 
1308  paWasapi->devInfo = (PaWasapiDeviceInfo *)PaUtil_AllocateMemory(sizeof(PaWasapiDeviceInfo) * paWasapi->deviceCount);
1309  if (paWasapi->devInfo == NULL)
1310  {
1311  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1312  goto error;
1313  }
1314  for (i = 0; i < paWasapi->deviceCount; ++i)
1315  memset(&paWasapi->devInfo[i], 0, sizeof(PaWasapiDeviceInfo));
1316 
1317  if (paWasapi->deviceCount > 0)
1318  {
1319  (*hostApi)->deviceInfos = (PaDeviceInfo **)PaUtil_GroupAllocateMemory(
1320  paWasapi->allocations, sizeof(PaDeviceInfo *) * paWasapi->deviceCount);
1321  if ((*hostApi)->deviceInfos == NULL)
1322  {
1323  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1324  goto error;
1325  }
1326 
1327  /* allocate all device info structs in a contiguous block */
1328  deviceInfoArray = (PaDeviceInfo *)PaUtil_GroupAllocateMemory(
1329  paWasapi->allocations, sizeof(PaDeviceInfo) * paWasapi->deviceCount);
1330  if (deviceInfoArray == NULL)
1331  {
1332  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1333  goto error;
1334  }
1335 
1336  for (devIndex = 0, i = 0; i < paWasapi->deviceCount; ++i, ++devIndex)
1337  {
1338  DWORD state = 0;
1339  PaDeviceInfo *deviceInfo = &deviceInfoArray[i];
1340  deviceInfo->structVersion = 2;
1341  deviceInfo->hostApi = hostApiIndex;
1342 
1343  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI: device idx: %02d\n", i));
1344  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI: ---------------\n"));
1345 
1346  hr = IMMDeviceCollection_Item(pEndPoints, devIndex, &paWasapi->devInfo[i].device);
1347  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1348  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1349  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1350 
1351  // getting ID
1352  {
1353  WCHAR *pszDeviceId = NULL;
1354  hr = IMMDevice_GetId(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device, &pszDeviceId);
1355  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1356  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);]
1357  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1358  wcsncpy(paWasapi->devInfo[i].szDeviceID, pszDeviceId, MAX_STR_LEN-1);
1359  CoTaskMemFree(pszDeviceId);
1360 
1361  if (lstrcmpW(paWasapi->devInfo[i].szDeviceID, paWasapi->defaultCapturer) == 0)
1362  {// we found the default input!
1363  (*hostApi)->info.defaultInputDevice = (*hostApi)->info.deviceCount;
1364  }
1365  if (lstrcmpW(paWasapi->devInfo[i].szDeviceID, paWasapi->defaultRenderer) == 0)
1366  {// we found the default output!
1367  (*hostApi)->info.defaultOutputDevice = (*hostApi)->info.deviceCount;
1368  }
1369  }
1370 
1371  hr = IMMDevice_GetState(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device, &paWasapi->devInfo[i].state);
1372  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1373  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1374  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1375 
1376  if (paWasapi->devInfo[i].state != DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVE)
1377  {
1378  PRINT(("WASAPI device: %d is not currently available (state:%d)\n",i,state));
1379  }
1380 
1381  {
1382  IPropertyStore *pProperty;
1383  hr = IMMDevice_OpenPropertyStore(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device, STGM_READ, &pProperty);
1384  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1385  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1386  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1387 
1388  // "Friendly" Name
1389  {
1390  char *deviceName;
1391  PROPVARIANT value;
1392  PropVariantInit(&value);
1393  hr = IPropertyStore_GetValue(pProperty, &PKEY_Device_FriendlyName, &value);
1394  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1395  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1396  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1397  deviceInfo->name = NULL;
1398  deviceName = (char *)PaUtil_GroupAllocateMemory(paWasapi->allocations, MAX_STR_LEN + 1);
1399  if (deviceName == NULL)
1400  {
1401  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1402  goto error;
1403  }
1404  if (value.pwszVal)
1405  WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, value.pwszVal, (int)wcslen(value.pwszVal), deviceName, MAX_STR_LEN-1, 0, 0);
1406  else
1407  _snprintf(deviceName, MAX_STR_LEN-1, "baddev%d", i);
1408  deviceInfo->name = deviceName;
1409  PropVariantClear(&value);
1410  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| name[%s]\n", i, deviceInfo->name));
1411  }
1412 
1413  // Default format
1414  {
1415  PROPVARIANT value;
1416  PropVariantInit(&value);
1417  hr = IPropertyStore_GetValue(pProperty, &PKEY_AudioEngine_DeviceFormat, &value);
1418  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1419  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1420  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1421  memcpy(&paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultFormat, value.blob.pBlobData, min(sizeof(paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultFormat), value.blob.cbSize));
1422  // cleanup
1423  PropVariantClear(&value);
1424  }
1425 
1426  // Formfactor
1427  {
1428  PROPVARIANT value;
1429  PropVariantInit(&value);
1430  hr = IPropertyStore_GetValue(pProperty, &PKEY_AudioEndpoint_FormFactor, &value);
1431  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1432  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1433  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1434  // set
1435  #if defined(DUMMYUNIONNAME) && defined(NONAMELESSUNION)
1436  // avoid breaking strict-aliasing rules in such line: (EndpointFormFactor)(*((UINT *)(((WORD *)&value.wReserved3)+1)));
1437  UINT v;
1438  memcpy(&v, (((WORD *)&value.wReserved3)+1), sizeof(v));
1439  paWasapi->devInfo[i].formFactor = (EndpointFormFactor)v;
1440  #else
1441  paWasapi->devInfo[i].formFactor = (EndpointFormFactor)value.uintVal;
1442  #endif
1443  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| form-factor[%d]\n", i, paWasapi->devInfo[i].formFactor));
1444  // cleanup
1445  PropVariantClear(&value);
1446  }
1447 
1448  SAFE_RELEASE(pProperty);
1449  }
1450 
1451 
1452  // Endpoint data
1453  {
1454  IMMEndpoint *endpoint = NULL;
1455  hr = IMMDevice_QueryInterface(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device, &pa_IID_IMMEndpoint, (void **)&endpoint);
1456  if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
1457  {
1458  hr = IMMEndpoint_GetDataFlow(endpoint, &paWasapi->devInfo[i].flow);
1459  SAFE_RELEASE(endpoint);
1460  }
1461  }
1462 
1463  // Getting a temporary IAudioClient for more fields
1464  // we make sure NOT to call Initialize yet!
1465  {
1466  IAudioClient *tmpClient = NULL;
1467 
1468  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device, GetAudioClientIID(),
1469  CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL, (void **)&tmpClient);
1470  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1471  // [IF_FAILED_JUMP(hResult, error);]
1472  IF_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR_JUMP(hr, result, error);
1473 
1474  hr = IAudioClient_GetDevicePeriod(tmpClient,
1475  &paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultDevicePeriod,
1476  &paWasapi->devInfo[i].MinimumDevicePeriod);
1477  if (FAILED(hr))
1478  {
1479  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| failed getting min/default periods by IAudioClient::GetDevicePeriod() with error[%08X], will use 30000/100000 hns\n", i, (UINT32)hr));
1480 
1481  // assign WASAPI common values
1482  paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultDevicePeriod = 100000;
1483  paWasapi->devInfo[i].MinimumDevicePeriod = 30000;
1484 
1485  // ignore error, let continue further without failing with paInternalError
1486  hr = S_OK;
1487  }
1488 
1489  //hr = tmpClient->GetMixFormat(&paWasapi->devInfo[i].MixFormat);
1490 
1491  // Release client
1492  SAFE_RELEASE(tmpClient);
1493 
1494  if (hr != S_OK)
1495  {
1496  //davidv: this happened with my hardware, previously for that same device in DirectSound:
1497  //Digital Output (Realtek AC'97 Audio)'s GUID: {0x38f2cf50,0x7b4c,0x4740,0x86,0xeb,0xd4,0x38,0x66,0xd8,0xc8, 0x9f}
1498  //so something must be _really_ wrong with this device, TODO handle this better. We kind of need GetMixFormat
1499  LogHostError(hr);
1500  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1501  result = paInternalError;
1502  goto error;
1503  }
1504  }
1505 
1506  // we can now fill in portaudio device data
1507  deviceInfo->maxInputChannels = 0;
1508  deviceInfo->maxOutputChannels = 0;
1509  deviceInfo->defaultSampleRate = paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultFormat.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
1510  switch (paWasapi->devInfo[i].flow)
1511  {
1512  case eRender: {
1513  deviceInfo->maxOutputChannels = paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultFormat.Format.nChannels;
1514  deviceInfo->defaultHighOutputLatency = nano100ToSeconds(paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultDevicePeriod);
1515  deviceInfo->defaultLowOutputLatency = nano100ToSeconds(paWasapi->devInfo[i].MinimumDevicePeriod);
1516  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| def.SR[%d] max.CH[%d] latency{hi[%f] lo[%f]}\n", i, (UINT32)deviceInfo->defaultSampleRate,
1517  deviceInfo->maxOutputChannels, (float)deviceInfo->defaultHighOutputLatency, (float)deviceInfo->defaultLowOutputLatency));
1518  break;}
1519  case eCapture: {
1520  deviceInfo->maxInputChannels = paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultFormat.Format.nChannels;
1521  deviceInfo->defaultHighInputLatency = nano100ToSeconds(paWasapi->devInfo[i].DefaultDevicePeriod);
1522  deviceInfo->defaultLowInputLatency = nano100ToSeconds(paWasapi->devInfo[i].MinimumDevicePeriod);
1523  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| def.SR[%d] max.CH[%d] latency{hi[%f] lo[%f]}\n", i, (UINT32)deviceInfo->defaultSampleRate,
1524  deviceInfo->maxInputChannels, (float)deviceInfo->defaultHighInputLatency, (float)deviceInfo->defaultLowInputLatency));
1525  break; }
1526  default:
1527  PRINT(("WASAPI:%d| bad Data Flow!\n", i));
1528  // We need to set the result to a value otherwise we will return paNoError
1529  result = paInternalError;
1530  //continue; // do not skip from list, allow to initialize
1531  break;
1532  }
1533 
1534  (*hostApi)->deviceInfos[i] = deviceInfo;
1535  ++(*hostApi)->info.deviceCount;
1536 
1537  if (paWasapi->devInfo[i].flow == eRender)
1538  {
1539  char *deviceName;
1540  UINT deviceNameLen;
1541 
1542  memcpy(&deviceInfoArray[i + 1], deviceInfo, sizeof(*deviceInfo));
1543  memcpy(&paWasapi->devInfo[i + 1], &paWasapi->devInfo[i], sizeof(*paWasapi->devInfo));
1544 
1545  i++;
1546  paWasapi->devInfo[i].loopBack = 1;
1547 
1548  deviceInfo = &deviceInfoArray[i];
1549 
1550  deviceInfo->maxInputChannels = deviceInfo->maxOutputChannels;
1551  deviceInfo->defaultHighInputLatency = deviceInfo->defaultHighOutputLatency;
1552  deviceInfo->defaultLowInputLatency = deviceInfo->defaultLowOutputLatency;
1553  deviceInfo->maxOutputChannels = 0;
1554  deviceInfo->defaultHighOutputLatency = 0;
1555  deviceInfo->defaultLowOutputLatency = 0;
1556  PA_DEBUG(("WASAPI:%d| def.SR[%d] max.CH[%d] latency{hi[%f] lo[%f]}\n", i, (UINT32)deviceInfo->defaultSampleRate,
1557  deviceInfo->maxInputChannels, (float)deviceInfo->defaultHighInputLatency, (float)deviceInfo->defaultLowInputLatency));
1558 
1559  IMMDevice_AddRef(paWasapi->devInfo[i].device);
1560 
1561  deviceName = (char *)PaUtil_GroupAllocateMemory(paWasapi->allocations, MAX_STR_LEN + 1);
1562  if (deviceName == NULL)
1563  {
1564  result = paInsufficientMemory;
1565  goto error;
1566  }
1567  _snprintf(deviceName, MAX_STR_LEN-1, "%s (loopback)", deviceInfo->name);
1568  deviceInfo->name = deviceName;
1569 
1570  (*hostApi)->deviceInfos[i] = deviceInfo;
1571  ++(*hostApi)->info.deviceCount;
1572  }
1573  }
1574  }
1575 
1576  (*hostApi)->Terminate = Terminate;
1577  (*hostApi)->OpenStream = OpenStream;
1578  (*hostApi)->IsFormatSupported = IsFormatSupported;
1579 
1580  PaUtil_InitializeStreamInterface( &paWasapi->callbackStreamInterface, CloseStream, StartStream,
1581  StopStream, AbortStream, IsStreamStopped, IsStreamActive,
1582  GetStreamTime, GetStreamCpuLoad,
1583  PaUtil_DummyRead, PaUtil_DummyWrite,
1584  PaUtil_DummyGetReadAvailable, PaUtil_DummyGetWriteAvailable );
1585 
1586  PaUtil_InitializeStreamInterface( &paWasapi->blockingStreamInterface, CloseStream, StartStream,
1587  StopStream, AbortStream, IsStreamStopped, IsStreamActive,
1588  GetStreamTime, PaUtil_DummyGetCpuLoad,
1589  ReadStream, WriteStream, GetStreamReadAvailable, GetStreamWriteAvailable );
1590 
1591 
1592  // findout if platform workaround is required
1593  paWasapi->useWOW64Workaround = UseWOW64Workaround();
1594 
1595  SAFE_RELEASE(pEndPoints);
1596 
1597  PRINT(("WASAPI: initialized ok\n"));
1598 
1599  return paNoError;
1600 
1601 error:
1602 
1603  PRINT(("WASAPI: failed %s error[%d|%s]\n", __FUNCTION__, result, Pa_GetErrorText(result)));
1604 
1605  SAFE_RELEASE(pEndPoints);
1606 
1607  Terminate((PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *)paWasapi);
1608 
1609  // Safety if error was not set so that we do not think initialize was a success
1610  if (result == paNoError) {
1611  result = paInternalError;
1612  }
1613 
1614  return result;
1615 }
1616 
1617 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1618 static void Terminate( PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *hostApi )
1619 {
1620  UINT i;
1621  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi = (PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation*)hostApi;
1622  if (paWasapi == NULL)
1623  return;
1624 
1625  // Release IMMDeviceEnumerator
1626  SAFE_RELEASE(paWasapi->enumerator);
1627 
1628  for (i = 0; i < paWasapi->deviceCount; ++i)
1629  {
1630  PaWasapiDeviceInfo *info = &paWasapi->devInfo[i];
1631  SAFE_RELEASE(info->device);
1632 
1633  //if (info->MixFormat)
1634  // CoTaskMemFree(info->MixFormat);
1635  }
1636  PaUtil_FreeMemory(paWasapi->devInfo);
1637 
1638  if (paWasapi->allocations)
1639  {
1640  PaUtil_FreeAllAllocations(paWasapi->allocations);
1641  PaUtil_DestroyAllocationGroup(paWasapi->allocations);
1642  }
1643 
1644  PaWinUtil_CoUninitialize( paWASAPI, &paWasapi->comInitializationResult );
1645 
1646  PaUtil_FreeMemory(paWasapi);
1647 
1648  // Close AVRT
1649  CloseAVRT();
1650 }
1651 
1652 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1653 static PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *_GetHostApi(PaError *_error)
1654 {
1655  PaError error;
1656 
1657  PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *pApi;
1658  if ((error = PaUtil_GetHostApiRepresentation(&pApi, paWASAPI)) != paNoError)
1659  {
1660  if (_error != NULL)
1661  (*_error) = error;
1662 
1663  return NULL;
1664  }
1665  return (PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *)pApi;
1666 }

1668 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1669 int PaWasapi_GetDeviceDefaultFormat( void *pFormat, unsigned int nFormatSize, PaDeviceIndex nDevice )
1670 {
1671  PaError ret;
1672  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi;
1673  UINT32 size;
1674  PaDeviceIndex index;
1675 
1676  if (pFormat == NULL)
1677  return paBadBufferPtr;
1678  if (nFormatSize <= 0)
1679  return paBufferTooSmall;
1680 
1681  // Get API
1682  paWasapi = _GetHostApi(&ret);
1683  if (paWasapi == NULL)
1684  return ret;
1685 
1686  // Get device index
1687  ret = PaUtil_DeviceIndexToHostApiDeviceIndex(&index, nDevice, &paWasapi->inheritedHostApiRep);
1688  if (ret != paNoError)
1689  return ret;
1690 
1691  // Validate index
1692  if ((UINT32)index >= paWasapi->deviceCount)
1693  return paInvalidDevice;
1694 
1695  size = min(nFormatSize, (UINT32)sizeof(paWasapi->devInfo[ index ].DefaultFormat));
1696  memcpy(pFormat, &paWasapi->devInfo[ index ].DefaultFormat, size);
1697 
1698  return size;
1699 }

1789 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1790 static void LogWAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE(const WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE *in)
1791 {
1792  const WAVEFORMATEX *old = (WAVEFORMATEX *)in;
1793  switch (old->wFormatTag)
1794  {
1795  case WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE: {
1796 
1797  PRINT(("wFormatTag =WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE\n"));
1798 
1799  if (IsEqualGUID(&in->SubFormat, &pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT))
1800  {
1801  PRINT(("SubFormat =KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT\n"));
1802  }
1803  else
1804  if (IsEqualGUID(&in->SubFormat, &pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM))
1805  {
1806  PRINT(("SubFormat =KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM\n"));
1807  }
1808  else
1809  {
1810  PRINT(("SubFormat =CUSTOM GUID{%d:%d:%d:%d%d%d%d%d%d%d%d}\n",
1811  in->SubFormat.Data1,
1812  in->SubFormat.Data2,
1813  in->SubFormat.Data3,
1814  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[0],
1815  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[1],
1816  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[2],
1817  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[3],
1818  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[4],
1819  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[5],
1820  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[6],
1821  (int)in->SubFormat.Data4[7]));
1822  }
1823  PRINT(("Samples.wValidBitsPerSample =%d\n", in->Samples.wValidBitsPerSample));
1824  PRINT(("dwChannelMask =0x%X\n",in->dwChannelMask));
1825 
1826  break; }
1827 
1828  case WAVE_FORMAT_PCM: PRINT(("wFormatTag =WAVE_FORMAT_PCM\n")); break;
1829  case WAVE_FORMAT_IEEE_FLOAT: PRINT(("wFormatTag =WAVE_FORMAT_IEEE_FLOAT\n")); break;
1830  default:
1831  PRINT(("wFormatTag =UNKNOWN(%d)\n",old->wFormatTag)); break;
1832  }
1833 
1834  PRINT(("nChannels =%d\n",old->nChannels));
1835  PRINT(("nSamplesPerSec =%d\n",old->nSamplesPerSec));
1836  PRINT(("nAvgBytesPerSec=%d\n",old->nAvgBytesPerSec));
1837  PRINT(("nBlockAlign =%d\n",old->nBlockAlign));
1838  PRINT(("wBitsPerSample =%d\n",old->wBitsPerSample));
1839  PRINT(("cbSize =%d\n",old->cbSize));
1840 }

1842 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1843 static PaSampleFormat WaveToPaFormat(const WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE *in)
1844 {
1845  const WAVEFORMATEX *old = (WAVEFORMATEX *)in;
1846 
1847  switch (old->wFormatTag)
1848  {
1849  case WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE: {
1850  if (IsEqualGUID(&in->SubFormat, &pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT))
1851  {
1852  if (in->Samples.wValidBitsPerSample == 32)
1853  return paFloat32;
1854  }
1855  else
1856  if (IsEqualGUID(&in->SubFormat, &pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM))
1857  {
1858  switch (old->wBitsPerSample)
1859  {
1860  case 32: return paInt32;
1861  case 24: return paInt24;
1862  case 8: return paUInt8;
1863  case 16: return paInt16;
1864  }
1865  }
1866  break; }
1867 
1868  case WAVE_FORMAT_IEEE_FLOAT:
1869  return paFloat32;
1870 
1871  case WAVE_FORMAT_PCM: {
1872  switch (old->wBitsPerSample)
1873  {
1874  case 32: return paInt32;
1875  case 24: return paInt24;
1876  case 8: return paUInt8;
1877  case 16: return paInt16;
1878  }
1879  break; }
1880  }
1881 
1882  return paCustomFormat;
1883 }
1884 
1885 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1886 static PaError MakeWaveFormatFromParams(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE *wavex, const PaStreamParameters *params,
1887  double sampleRate)
1888 {
1889  WORD bitsPerSample;
1890  WAVEFORMATEX *old;
1891  DWORD channelMask = 0;
1892  PaWasapiStreamInfo *streamInfo = (PaWasapiStreamInfo *)params->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
1893 
1894  // Get user assigned channel mask
1895  if ((streamInfo != NULL) && (streamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiUseChannelMask))
1896  channelMask = streamInfo->channelMask;
1897 
1898  // Convert PaSampleFormat to bits per sample
1899  if ((bitsPerSample = PaSampleFormatToBitsPerSample(params->sampleFormat)) == 0)
1900  return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
1901 
1902  memset(wavex, 0, sizeof(*wavex));
1903 
1904  old = (WAVEFORMATEX *)wavex;
1905  old->nChannels = (WORD)params->channelCount;
1906  old->nSamplesPerSec = (DWORD)sampleRate;
1907  if ((old->wBitsPerSample = bitsPerSample) > 16)
1908  {
1909  old->wBitsPerSample = 32; // 20 or 24 bits must go in 32 bit containers (ints)
1910  }
1911  old->nBlockAlign = (old->nChannels * (old->wBitsPerSample/8));
1912  old->nAvgBytesPerSec = (old->nSamplesPerSec * old->nBlockAlign);
1913 
1914  // WAVEFORMATEX
1915  if ((params->channelCount <= 2) && ((bitsPerSample == 16) || (bitsPerSample == 8)))
1916  {
1917  old->cbSize = 0;
1918  old->wFormatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_PCM;
1919  }
1920  // WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE
1921  else
1922  {
1923  old->wFormatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE;
1924  old->cbSize = sizeof(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE) - sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX);
1925 
1926  if ((params->sampleFormat & ~paNonInterleaved) == paFloat32)
1927  wavex->SubFormat = pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT;
1928  else
1929  wavex->SubFormat = pa_KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM;
1930 
1931  wavex->Samples.wValidBitsPerSample = bitsPerSample; //no extra padding!
1932 
1933  // Set channel mask
1934  if (channelMask != 0)
1935  {
1936  wavex->dwChannelMask = channelMask;
1937  }
1938  else
1939  {
1940  switch (params->channelCount)
1941  {
1942  case 1: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_MONO; break;
1943  case 2: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_STEREO; break;
1944  case 3: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_STEREO|SPEAKER_LOW_FREQUENCY; break;
1945  case 4: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_QUAD; break;
1946  case 5: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_QUAD|SPEAKER_LOW_FREQUENCY; break;
1947 #ifdef KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1_SURROUND
1948  case 6: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1_SURROUND; break;
1949 #else
1950  case 6: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1; break;
1951 #endif
1952 #ifdef KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1_SURROUND
1953  case 7: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1_SURROUND|SPEAKER_BACK_CENTER; break;
1954 #else
1955  case 7: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_5POINT1|SPEAKER_BACK_CENTER; break;
1956 #endif
1957 #ifdef KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_7POINT1_SURROUND
1958  case 8: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_7POINT1_SURROUND; break;
1959 #else
1960  case 8: wavex->dwChannelMask = KSAUDIO_SPEAKER_7POINT1; break;
1961 #endif
1962 
1963  default: wavex->dwChannelMask = 0;
1964  }
1965  }
1966  }
1967  return paNoError;
1968 }

2019 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2020 static PaError GetClosestFormat(IAudioClient *myClient, double sampleRate,
2021  const PaStreamParameters *_params, AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE shareMode, WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE *outWavex,
2022  BOOL output)
2023 {
2024  PaError answer = paInvalidSampleRate;
2025  WAVEFORMATEX *sharedClosestMatch = NULL;
2026  HRESULT hr = !S_OK;
2027  PaStreamParameters params = (*_params);
2028 
2029  /* It was not noticed that 24-bit Input producing no output while device accepts this format.
2030  To fix this issue let's ask for 32-bits and let PA converters convert host 32-bit data
2031  to 24-bit for user-space. The bug concerns Vista, if Windows 7 supports 24-bits for Input
2032  please report to PortAudio developers to exclude Windows 7.
2033  */
2034  /*if ((params.sampleFormat == paInt24) && (output == FALSE))
2035  params.sampleFormat = paFloat32;*/ // <<< The silence was due to missing Int32_To_Int24_Dither implementation
2036 
2037  MakeWaveFormatFromParams(outWavex, &params, sampleRate);
2038 
2039  hr = IAudioClient_IsFormatSupported(myClient, shareMode, &outWavex->Format, (shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED ? &sharedClosestMatch : NULL));
2040  if (hr == S_OK)
2041  answer = paFormatIsSupported;
2042  else
2043  if (sharedClosestMatch)
2044  {
2045  WORD bitsPerSample;
2046  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE *ext = (WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE*)sharedClosestMatch;
2047 
2048  GUID subf_guid = GUID_NULL;
2049  if (sharedClosestMatch->wFormatTag == WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE)
2050  {
2051  memcpy(outWavex, sharedClosestMatch, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE));
2052  subf_guid = ext->SubFormat;
2053  }
2054  else
2055  memcpy(outWavex, sharedClosestMatch, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX));
2056 
2057  CoTaskMemFree(sharedClosestMatch);
2058 
2059  // Make supported by default
2060  answer = paFormatIsSupported;
2061 
2062  // Validate SampleRate
2063  if ((DWORD)sampleRate != outWavex->Format.nSamplesPerSec)
2064  return paInvalidSampleRate;
2065 
2066  // Validate Channel count
2067  if ((WORD)params.channelCount != outWavex->Format.nChannels)
2068  {
2069  // If mono, then driver does not support 1 channel, we use internal workaround
2070  // of tiny software mixing functionality, e.g. we provide to user buffer 1 channel
2071  // but then mix into 2 for device buffer
2072  if ((params.channelCount == 1) && (outWavex->Format.nChannels == 2))
2073  return paFormatIsSupported;
2074  else
2075  return paInvalidChannelCount;
2076  }
2077 
2078  // Validate Sample format
2079  if ((bitsPerSample = PaSampleFormatToBitsPerSample(params.sampleFormat)) == 0)
2080  return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2081 
2082  // Validate Sample format: bit size (WASAPI does not limit 'bit size')
2083  //if (bitsPerSample != outWavex->Format.wBitsPerSample)
2084  // return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2085 
2086  // Validate Sample format: paFloat32 (WASAPI does not limit 'bit type')
2087  //if ((params->sampleFormat == paFloat32) && (subf_guid != KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_IEEE_FLOAT))
2088  // return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2089 
2090  // Validate Sample format: paInt32 (WASAPI does not limit 'bit type')
2091  //if ((params->sampleFormat == paInt32) && (subf_guid != KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM))
2092  // return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2093  }
2094  else
2095  {
2096  static const int BestToWorst[] = { paFloat32, paInt24, paInt16 };
2097  int i;
2098 
2099  // Try combination stereo and we will use built-in mono-stereo mixer then
2100  if (params.channelCount == 1)
2101  {
2102  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE stereo = { 0 };
2103 
2104  PaStreamParameters stereo_params = params;
2105  stereo_params.channelCount = 2;
2106 
2107  MakeWaveFormatFromParams(&stereo, &stereo_params, sampleRate);
2108 
2109  hr = IAudioClient_IsFormatSupported(myClient, shareMode, &stereo.Format, (shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED ? &sharedClosestMatch : NULL));
2110  if (hr == S_OK)
2111  {
2112  memcpy(outWavex, &stereo, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE));
2113  CoTaskMemFree(sharedClosestMatch);
2114  return (answer = paFormatIsSupported);
2115  }
2116 
2117  // Try selecting suitable sample type
2118  for (i = 0; i < STATIC_ARRAY_SIZE(BestToWorst); ++i)
2119  {
2120  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE sample = { 0 };
2121 
2122  PaStreamParameters sample_params = stereo_params;
2123  sample_params.sampleFormat = BestToWorst[i];
2124 
2125  MakeWaveFormatFromParams(&sample, &sample_params, sampleRate);
2126 
2127  hr = IAudioClient_IsFormatSupported(myClient, shareMode, &sample.Format, (shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED ? &sharedClosestMatch : NULL));
2128  if (hr == S_OK)
2129  {
2130  memcpy(outWavex, &sample, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE));
2131  CoTaskMemFree(sharedClosestMatch);
2132  return (answer = paFormatIsSupported);
2133  }
2134  }
2135  }
2136 
2137  // Try selecting suitable sample type
2138  for (i = 0; i < STATIC_ARRAY_SIZE(BestToWorst); ++i)
2139  {
2140  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE spfmt = { 0 };
2141 
2142  PaStreamParameters spfmt_params = params;
2143  spfmt_params.sampleFormat = BestToWorst[i];
2144 
2145  MakeWaveFormatFromParams(&spfmt, &spfmt_params, sampleRate);
2146 
2147  hr = IAudioClient_IsFormatSupported(myClient, shareMode, &spfmt.Format, (shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED ? &sharedClosestMatch : NULL));
2148  if (hr == S_OK)
2149  {
2150  memcpy(outWavex, &spfmt, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE));
2151  CoTaskMemFree(sharedClosestMatch);
2152  answer = paFormatIsSupported;
2153  break;
2154  }
2155  }
2156 
2157  // Nothing helped
2158  LogHostError(hr);
2159  }
2160 
2161  return answer;
2162 }
