2164 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2165 static PaError IsStreamParamsValid(struct PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *hostApi,
2166  const PaStreamParameters *inputParameters,
2167  const PaStreamParameters *outputParameters,
2168  double sampleRate)
2169 {
2170  if (hostApi == NULL)
2171  return paHostApiNotFound;
2172  if ((UINT32)sampleRate == 0)
2173  return paInvalidSampleRate;
2174 
2175  if (inputParameters != NULL)
2176  {
2177  /* all standard sample formats are supported by the buffer adapter,
2178  this implementation doesn't support any custom sample formats */
2179  if (inputParameters->sampleFormat & paCustomFormat)
2180  return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2181 
2182  /* unless alternate device specification is supported, reject the use of
2183  paUseHostApiSpecificDeviceSpecification */
2184  if (inputParameters->device == paUseHostApiSpecificDeviceSpecification)
2185  return paInvalidDevice;
2186 
2187  /* check that input device can support inputChannelCount */
2188  if (inputParameters->channelCount > hostApi->deviceInfos[ inputParameters->device ]->maxInputChannels)
2189  return paInvalidChannelCount;
2190 
2191  /* validate inputStreamInfo */
2192  if (inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo)
2193  {
2194  PaWasapiStreamInfo *inputStreamInfo = (PaWasapiStreamInfo *)inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2195  if ((inputStreamInfo->size != sizeof(PaWasapiStreamInfo)) ||
2196  (inputStreamInfo->version != 1) ||
2197  (inputStreamInfo->hostApiType != paWASAPI))
2198  {
2199  return paIncompatibleHostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2200  }
2201  }
2202 
2203  return paNoError;
2204  }
2205 
2206  if (outputParameters != NULL)
2207  {
2208  /* all standard sample formats are supported by the buffer adapter,
2209  this implementation doesn't support any custom sample formats */
2210  if (outputParameters->sampleFormat & paCustomFormat)
2211  return paSampleFormatNotSupported;
2212 
2213  /* unless alternate device specification is supported, reject the use of
2214  paUseHostApiSpecificDeviceSpecification */
2215  if (outputParameters->device == paUseHostApiSpecificDeviceSpecification)
2216  return paInvalidDevice;
2217 
2218  /* check that output device can support outputChannelCount */
2219  if (outputParameters->channelCount > hostApi->deviceInfos[ outputParameters->device ]->maxOutputChannels)
2220  return paInvalidChannelCount;
2221 
2222  /* validate outputStreamInfo */
2223  if(outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo)
2224  {
2225  PaWasapiStreamInfo *outputStreamInfo = (PaWasapiStreamInfo *)outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2226  if ((outputStreamInfo->size != sizeof(PaWasapiStreamInfo)) ||
2227  (outputStreamInfo->version != 1) ||
2228  (outputStreamInfo->hostApiType != paWASAPI))
2229  {
2230  return paIncompatibleHostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2231  }
2232  }
2233 
2234  return paNoError;
2235  }
2236 
2237  return (inputParameters || outputParameters ? paNoError : paInternalError);
2238 }
2239 
2240 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2241 static PaError IsFormatSupported( struct PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *hostApi,
2242  const PaStreamParameters *inputParameters,
2243  const PaStreamParameters *outputParameters,
2244  double sampleRate )
2245 {
2246  IAudioClient *tmpClient = NULL;
2247  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi = (PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation*)hostApi;
2248  PaWasapiStreamInfo *inputStreamInfo = NULL, *outputStreamInfo = NULL;
2249 
2250  // Validate PaStreamParameters
2251  PaError error;
2252  if ((error = IsStreamParamsValid(hostApi, inputParameters, outputParameters, sampleRate)) != paNoError)
2253  return error;
2254 
2255  if (inputParameters != NULL)
2256  {
2257  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE wavex;
2258  HRESULT hr;
2259  PaError answer;
2260  AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED;
2261  inputStreamInfo = (PaWasapiStreamInfo *)inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2262 
2263  if (inputStreamInfo && (inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiExclusive))
2264  shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE;
2265 
2266  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(paWasapi->devInfo[inputParameters->device].device,
2267  GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL, (void **)&tmpClient);
2268  if (hr != S_OK)
2269  {
2270  LogHostError(hr);
2271  return paInvalidDevice;
2272  }
2273 
2274  answer = GetClosestFormat(tmpClient, sampleRate, inputParameters, shareMode, &wavex, FALSE);
2275  SAFE_RELEASE(tmpClient);
2276 
2277  if (answer != paFormatIsSupported)
2278  return answer;
2279  }
2280 
2281  if (outputParameters != NULL)
2282  {
2283  HRESULT hr;
2284  WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE wavex;
2285  PaError answer;
2286  AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED;
2287  outputStreamInfo = (PaWasapiStreamInfo *)outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo;
2288 
2289  if (outputStreamInfo && (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiExclusive))
2290  shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE;
2291 
2292  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(paWasapi->devInfo[outputParameters->device].device,
2293  GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL, (void **)&tmpClient);
2294  if (hr != S_OK)
2295  {
2296  LogHostError(hr);
2297  return paInvalidDevice;
2298  }
2299 
2300  answer = GetClosestFormat(tmpClient, sampleRate, outputParameters, shareMode, &wavex, TRUE);
2301  SAFE_RELEASE(tmpClient);
2302 
2303  if (answer != paFormatIsSupported)
2304  return answer;
2305  }
2306 
2307  return paFormatIsSupported;
2308 }
2309 
2310 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2311 static PaUint32 PaUtil_GetFramesPerHostBuffer(PaUint32 userFramesPerBuffer, PaTime suggestedLatency, double sampleRate, PaUint32 TimerJitterMs)
2312 {
2313  PaUint32 frames = userFramesPerBuffer + max( userFramesPerBuffer, (PaUint32)(suggestedLatency * sampleRate) );
2314  frames += (PaUint32)((sampleRate * 0.001) * TimerJitterMs);
2315  return frames;
2316 }
2317 
2318 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2319 static void _RecalculateBuffersCount(PaWasapiSubStream *sub, UINT32 userFramesPerBuffer, UINT32 framesPerLatency, BOOL fullDuplex)
2320 {
2321  // Count buffers (must be at least 1)
2322  sub->buffers = (userFramesPerBuffer ? framesPerLatency / userFramesPerBuffer : 0);
2323  if (sub->buffers == 0)
2324  sub->buffers = 1;
2325 
2326  // Determine amount of buffers used:
2327  // - Full-duplex mode will lead to period difference, thus only 1.
2328  // - Input mode, only 1, as WASAPI allows extraction of only 1 packet.
2329  // - For Shared mode we use double buffering.
2330  if ((sub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE) || fullDuplex)
2331  {
2332  // Exclusive mode does not allow >1 buffers be used for Event interface, e.g. GetBuffer
2333  // call must acquire max buffer size and it all must be processed.
2334  if (sub->streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK)
2335  sub->userBufferAndHostMatch = 1;
2336 
2337  // Use paUtilBoundedHostBufferSize because exclusive mode will starve and produce
2338  // bad quality of audio
2339  sub->buffers = 1;
2340  }
2341 }
2342 
2343 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2344 static void _CalculateAlignedPeriod(PaWasapiSubStream *pSub, UINT32 *nFramesPerLatency,
2345  ALIGN_FUNC pAlignFunc)
2346 {
2347  // Align frames to HD Audio packet size of 128 bytes for Exclusive mode only.
2348  // Not aligning on Windows Vista will cause Event timeout, although Windows 7 will
2349  // return AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_NOT_ALIGNED error to realign buffer. Aligning is necessary
2350  // for Exclusive mode only! when audio data is feeded directly to hardware.
2351  if (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE)
2352  {
2353  (*nFramesPerLatency) = AlignFramesPerBuffer((*nFramesPerLatency),
2354  pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec, pSub->wavex.Format.nBlockAlign, pAlignFunc);
2355  }
2356 
2357  // Calculate period
2358  pSub->period = MakeHnsPeriod((*nFramesPerLatency), pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2359 }
2360 
2361 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2362 static HRESULT CreateAudioClient(PaWasapiStream *pStream, PaWasapiSubStream *pSub, BOOL output, PaError *pa_error)
2363 {
2364  PaError error;
2365  HRESULT hr;
2366 
2367  const PaWasapiDeviceInfo *pInfo = pSub->params.device_info;
2368  const PaStreamParameters *params = &pSub->params.stream_params;
2369  UINT32 framesPerLatency = pSub->params.frames_per_buffer;
2370  double sampleRate = pSub->params.sample_rate;
2371  BOOL blocking = pSub->params.blocking;
2372  BOOL fullDuplex = pSub->params.full_duplex;
2373 
2374  const UINT32 userFramesPerBuffer = framesPerLatency;
2375  IAudioClient *audioClient = NULL;
2376 
2377  // Assume default failure due to some reason
2378  (*pa_error) = paInvalidDevice;
2379 
2380  // Validate parameters
2381  if (!pSub || !pInfo || !params)
2382  {
2383  (*pa_error) = paBadStreamPtr;
2384  return E_POINTER;
2385  }
2386  if ((UINT32)sampleRate == 0)
2387  {
2388  (*pa_error) = paInvalidSampleRate;
2389  return E_INVALIDARG;
2390  }
2391 
2392  // Get the audio client
2393  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(pInfo->device, GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_ALL, NULL, (void **)&audioClient);
2394  if (hr != S_OK)
2395  {
2396  (*pa_error) = paInsufficientMemory;
2397  LogHostError(hr);
2398  goto done;
2399  }
2400 
2401  // Get closest format
2402  if ((error = GetClosestFormat(audioClient, sampleRate, params, pSub->shareMode, &pSub->wavex, output)) != paFormatIsSupported)
2403  {
2404  (*pa_error) = error;
2405  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT);
2406  goto done; // fail, format not supported
2407  }
2408 
2409  // Check for Mono <<>> Stereo workaround
2410  if ((params->channelCount == 1) && (pSub->wavex.Format.nChannels == 2))
2411  {
2412  /*if (blocking)
2413  {
2414  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT);
2415  goto done; // fail, blocking mode not supported
2416  }*/
2417 
2418  // select mixer
2419  pSub->monoMixer = _GetMonoToStereoMixer(WaveToPaFormat(&pSub->wavex), (output ? MIX_DIR__1TO2 : MIX_DIR__2TO1_L));
2420  if (pSub->monoMixer == NULL)
2421  {
2422  (*pa_error) = paInvalidChannelCount;
2423  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT);
2424  goto done; // fail, no mixer for format
2425  }
2426  }
2427 
2428 #if 0
2429  // Add suggestd latency
2430  framesPerLatency += MakeFramesFromHns(SecondsTonano100(params->suggestedLatency), pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2431 #else
2432  // Calculate host buffer size
2433  if ((pSub->shareMode != AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE) &&
2434  (!pSub->streamFlags || ((pSub->streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK) == 0)))
2435  {
2436  framesPerLatency = PaUtil_GetFramesPerHostBuffer(userFramesPerBuffer,
2437  params->suggestedLatency, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec, 0/*,
2438  (pSub->streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK ? 0 : 1)*/);
2439  }
2440  else
2441  {
2442  REFERENCE_TIME overall;
2443 
2444  // Work 1:1 with user buffer (only polling allows to use >1)
2445  framesPerLatency += MakeFramesFromHns(SecondsTonano100(params->suggestedLatency), pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2446 
2447  // Use Polling if overall latency is > 5ms as it allows to use 100% CPU in a callback,
2448  // or user specified latency parameter
2449  overall = MakeHnsPeriod(framesPerLatency, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2450  if ((overall >= (106667*2)/*21.33ms*/) || ((INT32)(params->suggestedLatency*100000.0) != 0/*0.01 msec granularity*/))
2451  {
2452  framesPerLatency = PaUtil_GetFramesPerHostBuffer(userFramesPerBuffer,
2453  params->suggestedLatency, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec, 0/*,
2454  (streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK ? 0 : 1)*/);
2455 
2456  // Use Polling interface
2457  pSub->streamFlags &= ~AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK;
2458  PRINT(("WASAPI: CreateAudioClient: forcing POLL mode\n"));
2459  }
2460  }
2461 #endif
2462 
2463  // For full-duplex output resize buffer to be the same as for input
2464  if (output && fullDuplex)
2465  framesPerLatency = pStream->in.framesPerHostCallback;
2466 
2467  // Avoid 0 frames
2468  if (framesPerLatency == 0)
2469  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pInfo->DefaultDevicePeriod, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2470 
2471  // Exclusive Input stream renders data in 6 packets, we must set then the size of
2472  // single packet, total buffer size, e.g. required latency will be PacketSize * 6
2473  if (!output && (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE))
2474  {
2475  // Do it only for Polling mode
2476  if ((pSub->streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK) == 0)
2477  {
2478  framesPerLatency /= WASAPI_PACKETS_PER_INPUT_BUFFER;
2479  }
2480  }
2481 
2482  // Calculate aligned period
2483  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_BWD);
2484 
2488  if (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED)
2489  {
2490  if (pSub->period < pInfo->DefaultDevicePeriod)
2491  {
2492  pSub->period = pInfo->DefaultDevicePeriod;
2493  // Recalculate aligned period
2494  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2495  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_BWD);
2496  }
2497  }
2498  else
2499  {
2500  if (pSub->period < pInfo->MinimumDevicePeriod)
2501  {
2502  pSub->period = pInfo->MinimumDevicePeriod;
2503  // Recalculate aligned period
2504  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2505  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_FWD);
2506  }
2507  }
2508 
2513  {
2519  if (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE)
2520  {
2521  static const REFERENCE_TIME MAX_BUFFER_EVENT_DURATION = 500 * 10000;
2522  static const REFERENCE_TIME MAX_BUFFER_POLL_DURATION = 2000 * 10000;
2523 
2524  if (pSub->streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK) // pull mode, max 500ms
2525  {
2526  if (pSub->period > MAX_BUFFER_EVENT_DURATION)
2527  {
2528  pSub->period = MAX_BUFFER_EVENT_DURATION;
2529  // Recalculate aligned period
2530  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2531  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_BWD);
2532  }
2533  }
2534  else // push mode, max 2000ms
2535  {
2536  if (pSub->period > MAX_BUFFER_POLL_DURATION)
2537  {
2538  pSub->period = MAX_BUFFER_POLL_DURATION;
2539  // Recalculate aligned period
2540  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2541  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_BWD);
2542  }
2543  }
2544  }
2545  }
2546 
2547  // Set Raw mode (applicable only to IAudioClient2)
2548 #ifdef __IAudioClient2_INTERFACE_DEFINED__
2549  if (GetAudioClientVersion() >= 2)
2550  {
2551  pa_AudioClientProperties audioProps = { 0 };
2552  audioProps.cbSize = sizeof(pa_AudioClientProperties);
2553  audioProps.bIsOffload = FALSE;
2554  audioProps.eCategory = (AUDIO_STREAM_CATEGORY)pSub->params.wasapi_params.streamCategory;
2555  switch (pSub->params.wasapi_params.streamOption)
2556  {
2557  case eStreamOptionRaw:
2558  if (GetWindowsVersion() >= WINDOWS_8_1_SERVER2012R2)
2559  audioProps.Options = pa_AUDCLNT_STREAMOPTIONS_RAW;
2560  break;
2561  case eStreamOptionMatchFormat:
2562  if (GetWindowsVersion() >= WINDOWS_10_SERVER2016)
2563  audioProps.Options = pa_AUDCLNT_STREAMOPTIONS_MATCH_FORMAT;
2564  break;
2565  }
2566 
2567  hr = IAudioClient2_SetClientProperties((IAudioClient2 *)audioClient, (AudioClientProperties *)&audioProps);
2568  if (hr != S_OK)
2569  {
2570  PRINT(("WASAPI: IAudioClient2_SetClientProperties(Category = %d, Options = %d) failed with error = %08X\n", audioProps.eCategory, audioProps.Options, (UINT32)hr));
2571  }
2572  else
2573  {
2574  PRINT(("WASAPI: IAudioClient2 set properties: IsOffload = %d, Category = %d, Options = %d\n", audioProps.bIsOffload, audioProps.eCategory, audioProps.Options));
2575  }
2576  }
2577 #endif
2578 
2579  // Open the stream and associate it with an audio session
2580  hr = IAudioClient_Initialize(audioClient,
2581  pSub->shareMode,
2582  pSub->streamFlags,
2583  pSub->period,
2584  (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? pSub->period : 0),
2585  &pSub->wavex.Format,
2586  NULL);
2587 
2592  while ((hr == E_OUTOFMEMORY) && (pSub->period > (100 * 10000)))
2593  {
2594  PRINT(("WASAPI: CreateAudioClient: decreasing buffer size to %d milliseconds\n", (pSub->period / 10000)));
2595 
2596  // Decrease by 100ms and try again
2597  pSub->period -= (100 * 10000);
2598 
2599  // Recalculate aligned period
2600  framesPerLatency = MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2601  _CalculateAlignedPeriod(pSub, &framesPerLatency, ALIGN_BWD);
2602 
2603  // Release the previous allocations
2604  SAFE_RELEASE(audioClient);
2605 
2606  // Create a new audio client
2607  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(pInfo->device, GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_ALL, NULL, (void**)&audioClient);
2608  if (hr != S_OK)
2609  {
2610  (*pa_error) = paInsufficientMemory;
2611  LogHostError(hr);
2612  goto done;
2613  }
2614 
2615  // Open the stream and associate it with an audio session
2616  hr = IAudioClient_Initialize(audioClient,
2617  pSub->shareMode,
2618  pSub->streamFlags,
2619  pSub->period,
2620  (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? pSub->period : 0),
2621  &pSub->wavex.Format,
2622  NULL);
2623  }
2624 
2627  if (hr == AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_ERROR)
2628  {
2629  // Use default
2630  pSub->period = pInfo->DefaultDevicePeriod;
2631 
2632  PRINT(("WASAPI: CreateAudioClient: correcting buffer size to device default\n"));
2633 
2634  // Release the previous allocations
2635  SAFE_RELEASE(audioClient);
2636 
2637  // Create a new audio client
2638  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(pInfo->device, GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_ALL, NULL, (void**)&audioClient);
2639  if (hr != S_OK)
2640  {
2641  (*pa_error) = paInsufficientMemory;
2642  LogHostError(hr);
2643  goto done;
2644  }
2645 
2646  // Open the stream and associate it with an audio session
2647  hr = IAudioClient_Initialize(audioClient,
2648  pSub->shareMode,
2649  pSub->streamFlags,
2650  pSub->period,
2651  (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? pSub->period : 0),
2652  &pSub->wavex.Format,
2653  NULL);
2654  }
2655 
2659  if (hr == AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_SIZE_NOT_ALIGNED)
2660  {
2661  UINT32 frames = 0;
2662 
2663  // Get the next aligned frame
2664  hr = IAudioClient_GetBufferSize(audioClient, &frames);
2665  if (hr != S_OK)
2666  {
2667  (*pa_error) = paInvalidDevice;
2668  LogHostError(hr);
2669  goto done;
2670  }
2671 
2672  PRINT(("WASAPI: CreateAudioClient: aligning buffer size to % frames\n", frames));
2673 
2674  // Release the previous allocations
2675  SAFE_RELEASE(audioClient);
2676 
2677  // Create a new audio client
2678  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(pInfo->device, GetAudioClientIID(), CLSCTX_ALL, NULL, (void**)&audioClient);
2679  if (hr != S_OK)
2680  {
2681  (*pa_error) = paInsufficientMemory;
2682  LogHostError(hr);
2683  goto done;
2684  }
2685 
2686  // Get closest format
2687  if ((error = GetClosestFormat(audioClient, sampleRate, params, pSub->shareMode, &pSub->wavex, output)) != paFormatIsSupported)
2688  {
2689  (*pa_error) = error;
2690  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT); // fail, format not supported
2691  goto done;
2692  }
2693 
2694  // Check for Mono >> Stereo workaround
2695  if ((params->channelCount == 1) && (pSub->wavex.Format.nChannels == 2))
2696  {
2697  /*if (blocking)
2698  {
2699  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT);
2700  goto done; // fail, blocking mode not supported
2701  }*/
2702 
2703  // Select mixer
2704  pSub->monoMixer = _GetMonoToStereoMixer(WaveToPaFormat(&pSub->wavex), (output ? MIX_DIR__1TO2 : MIX_DIR__2TO1_L));
2705  if (pSub->monoMixer == NULL)
2706  {
2707  (*pa_error) = paInvalidChannelCount;
2708  LogHostError(hr = AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT);
2709  goto done; // fail, no mixer for format
2710  }
2711  }
2712 
2713  // Calculate period
2714  pSub->period = MakeHnsPeriod(frames, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
2715 
2716  // Open the stream and associate it with an audio session
2717  hr = IAudioClient_Initialize(audioClient,
2718  pSub->shareMode,
2719  pSub->streamFlags,
2720  pSub->period,
2721  (pSub->shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? pSub->period : 0),
2722  &pSub->wavex.Format,
2723  NULL);
2724  if (hr != S_OK)
2725  {
2726  (*pa_error) = paInvalidDevice;
2727  LogHostError(hr);
2728  goto done;
2729  }
2730  }
2731  else
2732  if (hr != S_OK)
2733  {
2734  (*pa_error) = paInvalidDevice;
2735  LogHostError(hr);
2736  goto done;
2737  }
2738 
2739  // Set client
2740  pSub->clientParent = audioClient;
2741  IAudioClient_AddRef(pSub->clientParent);
2742 
2743  // Recalculate buffers count
2744  _RecalculateBuffersCount(pSub,
2745  userFramesPerBuffer,
2746  MakeFramesFromHns(pSub->period, pSub->wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec),
2747  fullDuplex);
2748 
2749  // No error, client is succesfully created
2750  (*pa_error) = paNoError;
2751 
2752 done:
2753 
2754  // Clean up
2755  SAFE_RELEASE(audioClient);
2756  return hr;
2757 }
2758 
2759 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2760 static PaError ActivateAudioClientOutput(PaWasapiStream *stream)
2761 {
2762  HRESULT hr;
2763  PaError result;
2764 
2765  UINT32 maxBufferSize = 0;
2766  PaTime buffer_latency = 0;
2767  UINT32 framesPerBuffer = stream->out.params.frames_per_buffer;
2768 
2769  // Create Audio client
2770  hr = CreateAudioClient(stream, &stream->out, TRUE, &result);
2771  if (hr != S_OK)
2772  {
2773  LogPaError(result);
2774  goto error;
2775  }
2776  LogWAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE(&stream->out.wavex);
2777 
2778  // Activate volume
2779  stream->outVol = NULL;
2780  /*hr = info->device->Activate(
2781  __uuidof(IAudioEndpointVolume), CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL,
2782  (void**)&stream->outVol);
2783  if (hr != S_OK)
2784  return paInvalidDevice;*/
2785 
2786  // Get max possible buffer size to check if it is not less than that we request
2787  hr = IAudioClient_GetBufferSize(stream->out.clientParent, &maxBufferSize);
2788  if (hr != S_OK)
2789  {
2790  LogHostError(hr);
2791  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
2792  goto error;
2793  }
2794 
2795  // Correct buffer to max size if it maxed out result of GetBufferSize
2796  stream->out.bufferSize = maxBufferSize;
2797 
2798  // Get interface latency (actually uneeded as we calculate latency from the size
2799  // of maxBufferSize).
2800  hr = IAudioClient_GetStreamLatency(stream->out.clientParent, &stream->out.deviceLatency);
2801  if (hr != S_OK)
2802  {
2803  LogHostError(hr);
2804  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
2805  goto error;
2806  }
2807  //stream->out.latencySeconds = nano100ToSeconds(stream->out.deviceLatency);
2808 
2809  // Number of frames that are required at each period
2810  stream->out.framesPerHostCallback = maxBufferSize;
2811 
2812  // Calculate frames per single buffer, if buffers > 1 then always framesPerBuffer
2813  stream->out.framesPerBuffer =
2814  (stream->out.userBufferAndHostMatch ? stream->out.framesPerHostCallback : framesPerBuffer);
2815 
2816  // Calculate buffer latency
2817  buffer_latency = (PaTime)maxBufferSize / stream->out.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
2818 
2819  // Append buffer latency to interface latency in shared mode (see GetStreamLatency notes)
2820  stream->out.latencySeconds = buffer_latency;
2821 
2822  PRINT(("WASAPI::OpenStream(output): framesPerUser[ %d ] framesPerHost[ %d ] latency[ %.02fms ] exclusive[ %s ] wow64_fix[ %s ] mode[ %s ]\n", (UINT32)framesPerBuffer, (UINT32)stream->out.framesPerHostCallback, (float)(stream->out.latencySeconds*1000.0f), (stream->out.shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? "YES" : "NO"), (stream->out.params.wow64_workaround ? "YES" : "NO"), (stream->out.streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK ? "EVENT" : "POLL")));
2823 
2824  return paNoError;
2825 
2826 error:
2827 
2828  return result;
2829 }
2830 
2831 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2832 static PaError ActivateAudioClientInput(PaWasapiStream *stream)
2833 {
2834  HRESULT hr;
2835  PaError result;
2836 
2837  UINT32 maxBufferSize = 0;
2838  PaTime buffer_latency = 0;
2839  UINT32 framesPerBuffer = stream->in.params.frames_per_buffer;
2840 
2841  // Create Audio client
2842  hr = CreateAudioClient(stream, &stream->in, FALSE, &result);
2843  if (hr != S_OK)
2844  {
2845  LogPaError(result);
2846  goto error;
2847  }
2848  LogWAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE(&stream->in.wavex);
2849 
2850  // Create volume mgr
2851  stream->inVol = NULL;
2852  /*hr = info->device->Activate(
2853  __uuidof(IAudioEndpointVolume), CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL,
2854  (void**)&stream->inVol);
2855  if (hr != S_OK)
2856  return paInvalidDevice;*/
2857 
2858  // Get max possible buffer size to check if it is not less than that we request
2859  hr = IAudioClient_GetBufferSize(stream->in.clientParent, &maxBufferSize);
2860  if (hr != S_OK)
2861  {
2862  LogHostError(hr);
2863  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
2864  goto error;
2865  }
2866 
2867  // Correct buffer to max size if it maxed out result of GetBufferSize
2868  stream->in.bufferSize = maxBufferSize;
2869 
2870  // Get interface latency (actually uneeded as we calculate latency from the size
2871  // of maxBufferSize).
2872  hr = IAudioClient_GetStreamLatency(stream->in.clientParent, &stream->in.deviceLatency);
2873  if (hr != S_OK)
2874  {
2875  LogHostError(hr);
2876  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
2877  goto error;
2878  }
2879  //stream->in.latencySeconds = nano100ToSeconds(stream->in.deviceLatency);
2880 
2881  // Number of frames that are required at each period
2882  stream->in.framesPerHostCallback = maxBufferSize;
2883 
2884  // Calculate frames per single buffer, if buffers > 1 then always framesPerBuffer
2885  stream->in.framesPerBuffer =
2886  (stream->in.userBufferAndHostMatch ? stream->in.framesPerHostCallback : framesPerBuffer);
2887 
2888  // Calculate buffer latency
2889  buffer_latency = (PaTime)maxBufferSize / stream->in.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
2890 
2891  // Append buffer latency to interface latency in shared mode (see GetStreamLatency notes)
2892  stream->in.latencySeconds = buffer_latency;
2893 
2894  PRINT(("WASAPI::OpenStream(input): framesPerUser[ %d ] framesPerHost[ %d ] latency[ %.02fms ] exclusive[ %s ] wow64_fix[ %s ] mode[ %s ]\n", (UINT32)framesPerBuffer, (UINT32)stream->in.framesPerHostCallback, (float)(stream->in.latencySeconds*1000.0f), (stream->in.shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? "YES" : "NO"), (stream->in.params.wow64_workaround ? "YES" : "NO"), (stream->in.streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK ? "EVENT" : "POLL")));
2895 
2896  return paNoError;
2897 
2898 error:
2899 
2900  return result;
2901 }

2903 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2904 static PaError OpenStream( struct PaUtilHostApiRepresentation *hostApi,
2905  PaStream** s,
2906  const PaStreamParameters *inputParameters,
2907  const PaStreamParameters *outputParameters,
2908  double sampleRate,
2909  unsigned long framesPerBuffer,
2910  PaStreamFlags streamFlags,
2911  PaStreamCallback *streamCallback,
2912  void *userData )
2913 {
2914  PaError result = paNoError;
2915  HRESULT hr;
2916  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi = (PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation*)hostApi;
2917  PaWasapiStream *stream = NULL;
2918  int inputChannelCount, outputChannelCount;
2919  PaSampleFormat inputSampleFormat, outputSampleFormat;
2920  PaSampleFormat hostInputSampleFormat, hostOutputSampleFormat;
2921  PaWasapiStreamInfo *inputStreamInfo = NULL, *outputStreamInfo = NULL;
2922  PaWasapiDeviceInfo *info = NULL;
2923  ULONG framesPerHostCallback;
2924  PaUtilHostBufferSizeMode bufferMode;
2925  const BOOL fullDuplex = ((inputParameters != NULL) && (outputParameters != NULL));
2926 
2927  // validate PaStreamParameters
2928  if ((result = IsStreamParamsValid(hostApi, inputParameters, outputParameters, sampleRate)) != paNoError)
2929  return LogPaError(result);
2930 
2931  // Validate platform specific flags
2932  if ((streamFlags & paPlatformSpecificFlags) != 0)
2933  {
2934  LogPaError(result = paInvalidFlag); /* unexpected platform specific flag */
2935  goto error;
2936  }
2937 
2938  // Allocate memory for PaWasapiStream
2939  if ((stream = (PaWasapiStream *)PaUtil_AllocateMemory(sizeof(PaWasapiStream))) == NULL)
2940  {
2941  LogPaError(result = paInsufficientMemory);
2942  goto error;
2943  }
2944 
2945  // Default thread priority is Audio: for exclusive mode we will use Pro Audio.
2946  stream->nThreadPriority = eThreadPriorityAudio;
2947 
2948  // Set default number of frames: paFramesPerBufferUnspecified
2949  if (framesPerBuffer == paFramesPerBufferUnspecified)
2950  {
2951  UINT32 framesPerBufferIn = 0, framesPerBufferOut = 0;
2952  if (inputParameters != NULL)
2953  {
2954  info = &paWasapi->devInfo[inputParameters->device];
2955  framesPerBufferIn = MakeFramesFromHns(info->DefaultDevicePeriod, (UINT32)sampleRate);
2956  }
2957  if (outputParameters != NULL)
2958  {
2959  info = &paWasapi->devInfo[outputParameters->device];
2960  framesPerBufferOut = MakeFramesFromHns(info->DefaultDevicePeriod, (UINT32)sampleRate);
2961  }
2962  // choosing maximum default size
2963  framesPerBuffer = max(framesPerBufferIn, framesPerBufferOut);
2964  }
2965  if (framesPerBuffer == 0)
2966  framesPerBuffer = ((UINT32)sampleRate / 100) * 2;
2967 
2968  stream->stopped = TRUE;
2969  stream->running = FALSE;
2970 
2971  // Try create device: Input
2972  if (inputParameters != NULL)
2973  {
2974  inputChannelCount = inputParameters->channelCount;
2975  inputSampleFormat = inputParameters->sampleFormat;
2976  info = &paWasapi->devInfo[inputParameters->device];
2977 
2978  // default Shared Mode
2979  stream->in.shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED;
2980 
2981  // PaWasapiStreamInfo
2982  if (inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo != NULL)
2983  {
2984  memcpy(&stream->in.params.wasapi_params, inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo, min(sizeof(stream->in.params.wasapi_params), ((PaWasapiStreamInfo *)inputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo)->size));
2985  stream->in.params.wasapi_params.size = sizeof(stream->in.params.wasapi_params);
2986 
2987  stream->in.params.stream_params.hostApiSpecificStreamInfo = &stream->in.params.wasapi_params;
2988  inputStreamInfo = &stream->in.params.wasapi_params;
2989 
2990  stream->in.flags = inputStreamInfo->flags;
2991 
2992  // Exclusive Mode
2993  if (inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiExclusive)
2994  {
2995  // Boost thread priority
2996  stream->nThreadPriority = eThreadPriorityProAudio;
2997  // Make Exclusive
2998  stream->in.shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE;
2999  }
3000 
3001  // explicit thread priority level
3002  if (inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiThreadPriority)
3003  {
3004  if ((inputStreamInfo->threadPriority > eThreadPriorityNone) &&
3005  (inputStreamInfo->threadPriority <= eThreadPriorityWindowManager))
3006  stream->nThreadPriority = inputStreamInfo->threadPriority;
3007  }
3008  }
3009 
3010  // Choose processing mode
3011  stream->in.streamFlags = (stream->in.shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK : 0);
3012  if (paWasapi->useWOW64Workaround)
3013  stream->in.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3014  else
3015  if (streamCallback == NULL)
3016  stream->in.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3017  else
3018  if ((inputStreamInfo != NULL) && (inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling))
3019  stream->in.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3020  else
3021  if (fullDuplex)
3022  stream->in.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface is implemented for full-duplex mode also
3023 
3024  if (info->flow == eRender)
3025  stream->in.streamFlags |= AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_LOOPBACK;
3026 
3027  // Fill parameters for Audio Client creation
3028  stream->in.params.device_info = info;
3029  stream->in.params.stream_params = (*inputParameters);
3030  stream->in.params.frames_per_buffer = framesPerBuffer;
3031  stream->in.params.sample_rate = sampleRate;
3032  stream->in.params.blocking = (streamCallback == NULL);
3033  stream->in.params.full_duplex = fullDuplex;
3034  stream->in.params.wow64_workaround = paWasapi->useWOW64Workaround;
3035 
3036  // Create and activate audio client
3037  hr = ActivateAudioClientInput(stream);
3038  if (hr != S_OK)
3039  {
3040  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
3041  goto error;
3042  }
3043 
3044  // Get closest format
3045  hostInputSampleFormat = PaUtil_SelectClosestAvailableFormat( WaveToPaFormat(&stream->in.wavex), inputSampleFormat );
3046 
3047  // Set user-side custom host processor
3048  if ((inputStreamInfo != NULL) &&
3049  (inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiRedirectHostProcessor))
3050  {
3051  stream->hostProcessOverrideInput.processor = inputStreamInfo->hostProcessorInput;
3052  stream->hostProcessOverrideInput.userData = userData;
3053  }
3054 
3055  // Only get IAudioCaptureClient input once here instead of getting it at multiple places based on the use
3056  hr = IAudioClient_GetService(stream->in.clientParent, &pa_IID_IAudioCaptureClient, (void **)&stream->captureClientParent);
3057  if (hr != S_OK)
3058  {
3059  LogHostError(hr);
3060  LogPaError(result = paUnanticipatedHostError);
3061  goto error;
3062  }
3063 
3064  // Create ring buffer for blocking mode (It is needed because we fetch Input packets, not frames,
3065  // and thus we have to save partial packet if such remains unread)
3066  if (stream->in.params.blocking == TRUE)
3067  {
3068  UINT32 bufferFrames = ALIGN_NEXT_POW2((stream->in.framesPerHostCallback / WASAPI_PACKETS_PER_INPUT_BUFFER) * 2);
3069  UINT32 frameSize = stream->in.wavex.Format.nBlockAlign;
3070 
3071  // buffer
3072  if ((stream->in.tailBuffer = PaUtil_AllocateMemory(sizeof(PaUtilRingBuffer))) == NULL)
3073  {
3074  LogPaError(result = paInsufficientMemory);
3075  goto error;
3076  }
3077  memset(stream->in.tailBuffer, 0, sizeof(PaUtilRingBuffer));
3078 
3079  // buffer memory region
3080  stream->in.tailBufferMemory = PaUtil_AllocateMemory(frameSize * bufferFrames);
3081  if (stream->in.tailBufferMemory == NULL)
3082  {
3083  LogPaError(result = paInsufficientMemory);
3084  goto error;
3085  }
3086 
3087  // initialize
3088  if (PaUtil_InitializeRingBuffer(stream->in.tailBuffer, frameSize, bufferFrames, stream->in.tailBufferMemory) != 0)
3089  {
3090  LogPaError(result = paInternalError);
3091  goto error;
3092  }
3093  }
3094  }
3095  else
3096  {
3097  inputChannelCount = 0;
3098  inputSampleFormat = hostInputSampleFormat = paInt16; /* Surpress 'uninitialised var' warnings. */
3099  }
3100 
3101  // Try create device: Output
3102  if (outputParameters != NULL)
3103  {
3104  outputChannelCount = outputParameters->channelCount;
3105  outputSampleFormat = outputParameters->sampleFormat;
3106  info = &paWasapi->devInfo[outputParameters->device];
3107 
3108  // default Shared Mode
3109  stream->out.shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED;
3110 
3111  // set PaWasapiStreamInfo
3112  if (outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo != NULL)
3113  {
3114  memcpy(&stream->out.params.wasapi_params, outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo, min(sizeof(stream->out.params.wasapi_params), ((PaWasapiStreamInfo *)outputParameters->hostApiSpecificStreamInfo)->size));
3115  stream->out.params.wasapi_params.size = sizeof(stream->out.params.wasapi_params);
3116 
3117  stream->out.params.stream_params.hostApiSpecificStreamInfo = &stream->out.params.wasapi_params;
3118  outputStreamInfo = &stream->out.params.wasapi_params;
3119 
3120  stream->out.flags = outputStreamInfo->flags;
3121 
3122  // Exclusive Mode
3123  if (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiExclusive)
3124  {
3125  // Boost thread priority
3126  stream->nThreadPriority = eThreadPriorityProAudio;
3127  // Make Exclusive
3128  stream->out.shareMode = AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE;
3129  }
3130 
3131  // explicit thread priority level
3132  if (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiThreadPriority)
3133  {
3134  if ((outputStreamInfo->threadPriority > eThreadPriorityNone) &&
3135  (outputStreamInfo->threadPriority <= eThreadPriorityWindowManager))
3136  stream->nThreadPriority = outputStreamInfo->threadPriority;
3137  }
3138  }
3139 
3140  // Choose processing mode
3141  stream->out.streamFlags = (stream->out.shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE ? AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK : 0);
3142  if (paWasapi->useWOW64Workaround)
3143  stream->out.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3144  else
3145  if (streamCallback == NULL)
3146  stream->out.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3147  else
3148  if ((outputStreamInfo != NULL) && (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling))
3149  stream->out.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface
3150  else
3151  if (fullDuplex)
3152  stream->out.streamFlags = 0; // polling interface is implemented for full-duplex mode also
3153 
3154  // Fill parameters for Audio Client creation
3155  stream->out.params.device_info = info;
3156  stream->out.params.stream_params = (*outputParameters);
3157  stream->out.params.frames_per_buffer = framesPerBuffer;
3158  stream->out.params.sample_rate = sampleRate;
3159  stream->out.params.blocking = (streamCallback == NULL);
3160  stream->out.params.full_duplex = fullDuplex;
3161  stream->out.params.wow64_workaround = paWasapi->useWOW64Workaround;
3162 
3163  // Create and activate audio client
3164  hr = ActivateAudioClientOutput(stream);
3165  if (hr != S_OK)
3166  {
3167  LogPaError(result = paInvalidDevice);
3168  goto error;
3169  }
3170 
3171  // Get closest format
3172  hostOutputSampleFormat = PaUtil_SelectClosestAvailableFormat( WaveToPaFormat(&stream->out.wavex), outputSampleFormat );
3173 
3174  // Set user-side custom host processor
3175  if ((outputStreamInfo != NULL) &&
3176  (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiRedirectHostProcessor))
3177  {
3178  stream->hostProcessOverrideOutput.processor = outputStreamInfo->hostProcessorOutput;
3179  stream->hostProcessOverrideOutput.userData = userData;
3180  }
3181 
3182  // Only get IAudioCaptureClient output once here instead of getting it at multiple places based on the use
3183  hr = IAudioClient_GetService(stream->out.clientParent, &pa_IID_IAudioRenderClient, (void **)&stream->renderClientParent);
3184  if (hr != S_OK)
3185  {
3186  LogHostError(hr);
3187  LogPaError(result = paUnanticipatedHostError);
3188  goto error;
3189  }
3190  }
3191  else
3192  {
3193  outputChannelCount = 0;
3194  outputSampleFormat = hostOutputSampleFormat = paInt16; /* Surpress 'uninitialized var' warnings. */
3195  }
3196 
3197  // log full-duplex
3198  if (fullDuplex)
3199  PRINT(("WASAPI::OpenStream: full-duplex mode\n"));
3200 
3201  // paWinWasapiPolling must be on/or not on both streams
3202  if ((inputParameters != NULL) && (outputParameters != NULL))
3203  {
3204  if ((inputStreamInfo != NULL) && (outputStreamInfo != NULL))
3205  {
3206  if (((inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling) &&
3207  !(outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling))
3208  ||
3209  (!(inputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling) &&
3210  (outputStreamInfo->flags & paWinWasapiPolling)))
3211  {
3212  LogPaError(result = paInvalidFlag);
3213  goto error;
3214  }
3215  }
3216  }
3217 
3218  // Initialize stream representation
3219  if (streamCallback)
3220  {
3221  stream->bBlocking = FALSE;
3222  PaUtil_InitializeStreamRepresentation(&stream->streamRepresentation,
3223  &paWasapi->callbackStreamInterface,
3224  streamCallback, userData);
3225  }
3226  else
3227  {
3228  stream->bBlocking = TRUE;
3229  PaUtil_InitializeStreamRepresentation(&stream->streamRepresentation,
3230  &paWasapi->blockingStreamInterface,
3231  streamCallback, userData);
3232  }
3233 
3234  // Initialize CPU measurer
3235  PaUtil_InitializeCpuLoadMeasurer(&stream->cpuLoadMeasurer, sampleRate);
3236 
3237  if (outputParameters && inputParameters)
3238  {
3239  // serious problem #1 - No, Not a problem, especially concerning Exclusive mode.
3240  // Input device in exclusive mode somehow is getting large buffer always, thus we
3241  // adjust Output latency to reflect it, thus period will differ but playback will be
3242  // normal.
3243  /*if (stream->in.period != stream->out.period)
3244  {
3245  PRINT(("WASAPI: OpenStream: period discrepancy\n"));
3246  LogPaError(result = paBadIODeviceCombination);
3247  goto error;
3248  }*/
3249 
3250  // serious problem #2 - No, Not a problem, as framesPerHostCallback take into account
3251  // sample size while it is not a problem for PA full-duplex, we must care of
3252  // preriod only!
3253  /*if (stream->out.framesPerHostCallback != stream->in.framesPerHostCallback)
3254  {
3255  PRINT(("WASAPI: OpenStream: framesPerHostCallback discrepancy\n"));
3256  goto error;
3257  }*/
3258  }
3259 
3260  // Calculate frames per host for processor
3261  framesPerHostCallback = (outputParameters ? stream->out.framesPerBuffer : stream->in.framesPerBuffer);
3262 
3263  // Choose correct mode of buffer processing:
3264  // Exclusive/Shared non paWinWasapiPolling mode: paUtilFixedHostBufferSize - always fixed
3265  // Exclusive/Shared paWinWasapiPolling mode: paUtilBoundedHostBufferSize - may vary for Exclusive or Full-duplex
3266  bufferMode = paUtilFixedHostBufferSize;
3267  if (inputParameters) // !!! WASAPI IAudioCaptureClient::GetBuffer extracts not number of frames but 1 packet, thus we always must adapt
3268  bufferMode = paUtilBoundedHostBufferSize;
3269  else
3270  if (outputParameters)
3271  {
3272  if ((stream->out.buffers == 1) &&
3273  (!stream->out.streamFlags || ((stream->out.streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK) == 0)))
3274  bufferMode = paUtilBoundedHostBufferSize;
3275  }
3276  stream->bufferMode = bufferMode;
3277 
3278  // Initialize buffer processor
3279  result = PaUtil_InitializeBufferProcessor(
3280  &stream->bufferProcessor,
3281  inputChannelCount,
3282  inputSampleFormat,
3283  hostInputSampleFormat,
3284  outputChannelCount,
3285  outputSampleFormat,
3286  hostOutputSampleFormat,
3287  sampleRate,
3288  streamFlags,
3289  framesPerBuffer,
3290  framesPerHostCallback,
3291  bufferMode,
3292  streamCallback,
3293  userData);
3294  if (result != paNoError)
3295  {
3296  LogPaError(result);
3297  goto error;
3298  }
3299 
3300  // Set Input latency
3301  stream->streamRepresentation.streamInfo.inputLatency =
3302  ((double)PaUtil_GetBufferProcessorInputLatencyFrames(&stream->bufferProcessor) / sampleRate)
3303  + ((inputParameters)?stream->in.latencySeconds : 0);
3304 
3305  // Set Output latency
3306  stream->streamRepresentation.streamInfo.outputLatency =
3307  ((double)PaUtil_GetBufferProcessorOutputLatencyFrames(&stream->bufferProcessor) / sampleRate)
3308  + ((outputParameters)?stream->out.latencySeconds : 0);
3309 
3310  // Set SR
3311  stream->streamRepresentation.streamInfo.sampleRate = sampleRate;
3312 
3313  (*s) = (PaStream *)stream;
3314  return result;
3315 
3316 error:
3317 
3318  if (stream != NULL)
3319  CloseStream(stream);
3320 
3321  return result;
3322 }

3324 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3325 static PaError CloseStream( PaStream* s )
3326 {
3327  PaError result = paNoError;
3328  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
3329 
3330  // abort active stream
3331  if (IsStreamActive(s))
3332  {
3333  result = AbortStream(s);
3334  }
3335 
3336  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->captureClientParent);
3337  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->renderClientParent);
3338  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->out.clientParent);
3339  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->in.clientParent);
3340  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->inVol);
3341  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->outVol);
3342 
3343  CloseHandle(stream->event[S_INPUT]);
3344  CloseHandle(stream->event[S_OUTPUT]);
3345 
3346  _StreamCleanup(stream);
3347 
3348  PaWasapi_FreeMemory(stream->in.monoBuffer);
3349  PaWasapi_FreeMemory(stream->out.monoBuffer);
3350 
3351  PaUtil_FreeMemory(stream->in.tailBuffer);
3352  PaUtil_FreeMemory(stream->in.tailBufferMemory);
3353 
3354  PaUtil_FreeMemory(stream->out.tailBuffer);
3355  PaUtil_FreeMemory(stream->out.tailBufferMemory);
3356 
3357  PaUtil_TerminateBufferProcessor(&stream->bufferProcessor);
3358  PaUtil_TerminateStreamRepresentation(&stream->streamRepresentation);
3359  PaUtil_FreeMemory(stream);
3360 
3361  return result;
3362 }

3373  substream->clientStream = NULL;
3374  if (hResult != S_OK)
3375  {
3376  hFirstBadResult = (hFirstBadResult == S_OK) ? hResult : hFirstBadResult;
3377  }
3378

3380 }

3382 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3383 HRESULT UnmarshalStreamComPointers(PaWasapiStream *stream)
3384 {
3385  HRESULT hResult = S_OK;
3386  HRESULT hFirstBadResult = S_OK;
3387  stream->captureClient = NULL;
3388  stream->renderClient = NULL;
3389  stream->in.clientProc = NULL;
3390  stream->out.clientProc = NULL;
3391 
3392  if (NULL != stream->in.clientParent)
3393  {
3394  // SubStream pointers
3395  hResult = UnmarshalSubStreamComPointers(&stream->in);
3396  if (hResult != S_OK)
3397  {
3398  hFirstBadResult = (hFirstBadResult == S_OK) ? hResult : hFirstBadResult;
3399  }
3400 
3401  // IAudioCaptureClient
3402  hResult = CoGetInterfaceAndReleaseStream(stream->captureClientStream, &pa_IID_IAudioCaptureClient, (LPVOID*)&stream->captureClient);
3403  stream->captureClientStream = NULL;
3404  if (hResult != S_OK)
3405  {
3406  hFirstBadResult = (hFirstBadResult == S_OK) ? hResult : hFirstBadResult;
3407  }
3408  }
3409 
3410  if (NULL != stream->out.clientParent)
3411  {
3412  // SubStream pointers
3413  hResult = UnmarshalSubStreamComPointers(&stream->out);
3414  if (hResult != S_OK)
3415  {
3416  hFirstBadResult = (hFirstBadResult == S_OK) ? hResult : hFirstBadResult;
3417  }
3418 
3419  // IAudioRenderClient
3420  hResult = CoGetInterfaceAndReleaseStream(stream->renderClientStream, &pa_IID_IAudioRenderClient, (LPVOID*)&stream->renderClient);
3421  stream->renderClientStream = NULL;
3422  if (hResult != S_OK)
3423  {
3424  hFirstBadResult = (hFirstBadResult == S_OK) ? hResult : hFirstBadResult;
3425  }
3426  }
3427 
3428  return hFirstBadResult;
3429 }
3430 
3431 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3432 void ReleaseUnmarshaledSubComPointers(PaWasapiSubStream *substream)
3433 {
3434  SAFE_RELEASE(substream->clientProc);
3435 }
3436 
3437 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3438 void ReleaseUnmarshaledComPointers(PaWasapiStream *stream)
3439 {
3440  // Release AudioClient services first
3441  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->captureClient);
3442  SAFE_RELEASE(stream->renderClient);
3443 
3444  // Release AudioClients
3445  ReleaseUnmarshaledSubComPointers(&stream->in);
3446  ReleaseUnmarshaledSubComPointers(&stream->out);
3447 }

3449 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3450 HRESULT MarshalSubStreamComPointers(PaWasapiSubStream *substream)
3451 {
3452  HRESULT hResult;
3453  substream->clientStream = NULL;
3454 
3455  // IAudioClient
3456  hResult = CoMarshalInterThreadInterfaceInStream(GetAudioClientIID(), (LPUNKNOWN)substream->clientParent, &substream->clientStream);
3457  if (hResult != S_OK)
3458  goto marshal_sub_error;
3459 
3460  return hResult;
3461 
3462  // If marshaling error occurred, make sure to release everything.
3463 marshal_sub_error:
3464 
3465  UnmarshalSubStreamComPointers(substream);
3466  ReleaseUnmarshaledSubComPointers(substream);
3467  return hResult;
3468 }
3469 
3470 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3471 HRESULT MarshalStreamComPointers(PaWasapiStream *stream)
3472 {
3473  HRESULT hResult = S_OK;
3474  stream->captureClientStream = NULL;
3475  stream->in.clientStream = NULL;
3476  stream->renderClientStream = NULL;
3477  stream->out.clientStream = NULL;
3478 
3479  if (NULL != stream->in.clientParent)
3480  {
3481  // SubStream pointers
3482  hResult = MarshalSubStreamComPointers(&stream->in);
3483  if (hResult != S_OK)
3484  goto marshal_error;
3485 
3486  // IAudioCaptureClient
3487  hResult = CoMarshalInterThreadInterfaceInStream(&pa_IID_IAudioCaptureClient, (LPUNKNOWN)stream->captureClientParent, &stream->captureClientStream);
3488  if (hResult != S_OK)
3489  goto marshal_error;
3490  }
3491 
3492  if (NULL != stream->out.clientParent)
3493  {
3494  // SubStream pointers
3495  hResult = MarshalSubStreamComPointers(&stream->out);
3496  if (hResult != S_OK)
3497  goto marshal_error;
3498 
3499  // IAudioRenderClient
3500  hResult = CoMarshalInterThreadInterfaceInStream(&pa_IID_IAudioRenderClient, (LPUNKNOWN)stream->renderClientParent, &stream->renderClientStream);
3501  if (hResult != S_OK)
3502  goto marshal_error;
3503  }
3504 
3505  return hResult;
3506 
3507  // If marshaling error occurred, make sure to release everything.
3508 marshal_error:
3509 
3510  UnmarshalStreamComPointers(stream);
3511  ReleaseUnmarshaledComPointers(stream);
3512  return hResult;
3513 }

3515 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3516 static PaError StartStream( PaStream *s )
3517 {
3518  HRESULT hr;
3519  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
3520  PaError result = paNoError;
3521 
3522  // check if stream is active already
3523  if (IsStreamActive(s))
3524  return paStreamIsNotStopped;
3525 
3526  PaUtil_ResetBufferProcessor(&stream->bufferProcessor);
3527 
3528  // Cleanup handles (may be necessary if stream was stopped by itself due to error)
3529  _StreamCleanup(stream);
3530 
3531  // Create close event
3532  if ((stream->hCloseRequest = CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL)) == NULL)
3533  {
3534  result = paInsufficientMemory;
3535  goto start_error;
3536  }
3537 
3538  // Create thread
3539  if (!stream->bBlocking)
3540  {
3541  // Create thread events
3542  stream->hThreadStart = CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL);
3543  stream->hThreadExit = CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, FALSE, NULL);
3544  if ((stream->hThreadStart == NULL) || (stream->hThreadExit == NULL))
3545  {
3546  result = paInsufficientMemory;
3547  goto start_error;
3548  }
3549 
3550  // Marshal WASAPI interface pointers for safe use in thread created below.
3551  if ((hr = MarshalStreamComPointers(stream)) != S_OK)
3552  {
3553  PRINT(("Failed marshaling stream COM pointers."));
3554  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3555  goto nonblocking_start_error;
3556  }
3557 
3558  if ((stream->in.clientParent && (stream->in.streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK)) ||
3559  (stream->out.clientParent && (stream->out.streamFlags & AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK)))
3560  {
3561  if ((stream->hThread = CREATE_THREAD(ProcThreadEvent)) == NULL)
3562  {
3563  PRINT(("Failed creating thread: ProcThreadEvent."));
3564  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3565  goto nonblocking_start_error;
3566  }
3567  }
3568  else
3569  {
3570  if ((stream->hThread = CREATE_THREAD(ProcThreadPoll)) == NULL)
3571  {
3572  PRINT(("Failed creating thread: ProcThreadPoll."));
3573  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3574  goto nonblocking_start_error;
3575  }
3576  }
3577 
3578  // Wait for thread to start
3579  if (WaitForSingleObject(stream->hThreadStart, 60*1000) == WAIT_TIMEOUT)
3580  {
3581  PRINT(("Failed starting thread: timeout."));
3582  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3583  goto nonblocking_start_error;
3584  }
3585  }
3586  else
3587  {
3588  // Create blocking operation events (non-signaled event means - blocking operation is pending)
3589  if (stream->out.clientParent != NULL)
3590  {
3591  if ((stream->hBlockingOpStreamWR = CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, TRUE, NULL)) == NULL)
3592  {
3593  result = paInsufficientMemory;
3594  goto start_error;
3595  }
3596  }
3597  if (stream->in.clientParent != NULL)
3598  {
3599  if ((stream->hBlockingOpStreamRD = CreateEvent(NULL, TRUE, TRUE, NULL)) == NULL)
3600  {
3601  result = paInsufficientMemory;
3602  goto start_error;
3603  }
3604  }
3605 
3606  // Initialize event & start INPUT stream
3607  if (stream->in.clientParent != NULL)
3608  {
3609  if ((hr = IAudioClient_Start(stream->in.clientParent)) != S_OK)
3610  {
3611  LogHostError(hr);
3612  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3613  goto start_error;
3614  }
3615  }
3616 
3617  // Initialize event & start OUTPUT stream
3618  if (stream->out.clientParent != NULL)
3619  {
3620  // Start
3621  if ((hr = IAudioClient_Start(stream->out.clientParent)) != S_OK)
3622  {
3623  LogHostError(hr);
3624  result = paUnanticipatedHostError;
3625  goto start_error;
3626  }
3627  }
3628 
3629  // Set parent to working pointers to use shared functions.
3630  stream->captureClient = stream->captureClientParent;
3631  stream->renderClient = stream->renderClientParent;
3632  stream->in.clientProc = stream->in.clientParent;
3633  stream->out.clientProc = stream->out.clientParent;
3634 
3635  // Signal: stream running.
3636  stream->running = TRUE;
3637  }
3638  stream->stopped = FALSE;
3639 
3640  return result;
3641 
3642 nonblocking_start_error:
3643 
3644  // Set hThreadExit event to prevent blocking during cleanup
3645  SetEvent(stream->hThreadExit);
3646  UnmarshalStreamComPointers(stream);
3647  ReleaseUnmarshaledComPointers(stream);
3648 
3649 start_error:
3650 
3651  StopStream(s);
3652  return result;
3653 }
3654 
3655 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3656 void _StreamFinish(PaWasapiStream *stream)
3657 {
3658  // Issue command to thread to stop processing and wait for thread exit
3659  if (!stream->bBlocking)
3660  {
3661  SignalObjectAndWait(stream->hCloseRequest, stream->hThreadExit, INFINITE, FALSE);
3662  }
3663  else
3664  // Blocking mode does not own thread
3665  {
3666  // Signal close event and wait for each of 2 blocking operations to complete
3667  if (stream->out.clientParent)
3668  SignalObjectAndWait(stream->hCloseRequest, stream->hBlockingOpStreamWR, INFINITE, TRUE);
3669  if (stream->out.clientParent)
3670  SignalObjectAndWait(stream->hCloseRequest, stream->hBlockingOpStreamRD, INFINITE, TRUE);
3671 
3672  // Process stop
3673  _StreamOnStop(stream);
3674  }
3675 
3676  // Cleanup handles
3677  _StreamCleanup(stream);
3678 
3679  stream->running = FALSE;
3680  stream->stopped = TRUE;
3681 }
3682 
3683 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3684 void _StreamCleanup(PaWasapiStream *stream)
3685 {
3686  // Close thread handles to allow restart
3687  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hThread);
3688  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hThreadStart);
3689  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hThreadExit);
3690  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hCloseRequest);
3691  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hBlockingOpStreamRD);
3692  SAFE_CLOSE(stream->hBlockingOpStreamWR);
3693 }
3694 
3695 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3696 static PaError StopStream( PaStream *s )
3697 {
3698  // Finish stream
3699  _StreamFinish((PaWasapiStream *)s);
3700  return paNoError;
3701 }

3708  return paNoError;
3709 }

3740 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3741 static PaError ReadStream( PaStream* s, void *_buffer, unsigned long frames )
3742 {
3743  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
3744 
3745  HRESULT hr = S_OK;
3746  BYTE *user_buffer = (BYTE *)_buffer;
3747  BYTE *wasapi_buffer = NULL;
3748  DWORD flags = 0;
3749  UINT32 i, available, sleep = 0;
3750  unsigned long processed;
3751  ThreadIdleScheduler sched;
3752 
3753  // validate
3754  if (!stream->running)
3755  return paStreamIsStopped;
3756  if (stream->captureClient == NULL)
3757  return paBadStreamPtr;
3758 
3759  // Notify blocking op has begun
3760  ResetEvent(stream->hBlockingOpStreamRD);
3761 
3762  // Use thread scheduling for 500 microseconds (emulated) when wait time for frames is less than
3763  // 1 milliseconds, emulation helps to normalize CPU consumption and avoids too busy waiting
3764  ThreadIdleScheduler_Setup(&sched, 1, 250/* microseconds */);
3765 
3766  // Make a local copy of the user buffer pointer(s), this is necessary
3767  // because PaUtil_CopyOutput() advances these pointers every time it is called
3768  if (!stream->bufferProcessor.userInputIsInterleaved)
3769  {
3770  user_buffer = (BYTE *)alloca(sizeof(BYTE *) * stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount);
3771  if (user_buffer == NULL)
3772  return paInsufficientMemory;
3773 
3774  for (i = 0; i < stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount; ++i)
3775  ((BYTE **)user_buffer)[i] = ((BYTE **)_buffer)[i];
3776  }
3777 
3778  // Findout if there are tail frames, flush them all before reading hardware
3779  if ((available = PaUtil_GetRingBufferReadAvailable(stream->in.tailBuffer)) != 0)
3780  {
3781  ring_buffer_size_t buf1_size = 0, buf2_size = 0, read, desired;
3782  void *buf1 = NULL, *buf2 = NULL;
3783 
3784  // Limit desired to amount of requested frames
3785  desired = available;
3786  if ((UINT32)desired > frames)
3787  desired = frames;
3788 
3789  // Get pointers to read regions
3790  read = PaUtil_GetRingBufferReadRegions(stream->in.tailBuffer, desired, &buf1, &buf1_size, &buf2, &buf2_size);
3791 
3792  if (buf1 != NULL)
3793  {
3794  // Register available frames to processor
3795  PaUtil_SetInputFrameCount(&stream->bufferProcessor, buf1_size);
3796 
3797  // Register host buffer pointer to processor
3798  PaUtil_SetInterleavedInputChannels(&stream->bufferProcessor, 0, buf1, stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount);
3799 
3800  // Copy user data to host buffer (with conversion if applicable)
3801  processed = PaUtil_CopyInput(&stream->bufferProcessor, (void **)&user_buffer, buf1_size);
3802  frames -= processed;
3803  }
3804 
3805  if (buf2 != NULL)
3806  {
3807  // Register available frames to processor
3808  PaUtil_SetInputFrameCount(&stream->bufferProcessor, buf2_size);
3809 
3810  // Register host buffer pointer to processor
3811  PaUtil_SetInterleavedInputChannels(&stream->bufferProcessor, 0, buf2, stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount);
3812 
3813  // Copy user data to host buffer (with conversion if applicable)
3814  processed = PaUtil_CopyInput(&stream->bufferProcessor, (void **)&user_buffer, buf2_size);
3815  frames -= processed;
3816  }
3817 
3818  // Advance
3819  PaUtil_AdvanceRingBufferReadIndex(stream->in.tailBuffer, read);
3820  }
3821 
3822  // Read hardware
3823  while (frames != 0)
3824  {
3825  // Check if blocking call must be interrupted
3826  if (WaitForSingleObject(stream->hCloseRequest, sleep) != WAIT_TIMEOUT)
3827  break;
3828 
3829  // Get available frames (must be finding out available frames before call to IAudioCaptureClient_GetBuffer
3830  // othervise audio glitches will occur inExclusive mode as it seems that WASAPI has some scheduling/
3831  // processing problems when such busy polling with IAudioCaptureClient_GetBuffer occurs)
3832  if ((hr = _PollGetInputFramesAvailable(stream, &available)) != S_OK)
3833  {
3834  LogHostError(hr);
3835  return paUnanticipatedHostError;
3836  }
3837 
3838  // Wait for more frames to become available
3839  if (available == 0)
3840  {
3841  // Exclusive mode may require latency of 1 millisecond, thus we shall sleep
3842  // around 500 microseconds (emulated) to collect packets in time
3843  if (stream->in.shareMode != AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_EXCLUSIVE)
3844  {
3845  UINT32 sleep_frames = (frames < stream->in.framesPerHostCallback ? frames : stream->in.framesPerHostCallback);
3846 
3847  sleep = GetFramesSleepTime(sleep_frames, stream->in.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
3848  sleep /= 4; // wait only for 1/4 of the buffer
3849 
3850  // WASAPI input provides packets, thus expiring packet will result in bad audio
3851  // limit waiting time to 2 seconds (will always work for smallest buffer in Shared)
3852  if (sleep > 2)
3853  sleep = 2;
3854 
3855  // Avoid busy waiting, schedule next 1 millesecond wait
3856  if (sleep == 0)
3857  sleep = ThreadIdleScheduler_NextSleep(&sched);
3858  }
3859  else
3860  {
3861  if ((sleep = ThreadIdleScheduler_NextSleep(&sched)) != 0)
3862  {
3863  Sleep(sleep);
3864  sleep = 0;
3865  }
3866  }
3867 
3868  continue;
3869  }
3870 
3871  // Get the available data in the shared buffer.
3872  if ((hr = IAudioCaptureClient_GetBuffer(stream->captureClient, &wasapi_buffer, &available, &flags, NULL, NULL)) != S_OK)
3873  {
3874  // Buffer size is too small, waiting
3875  if (hr != AUDCLNT_S_BUFFER_EMPTY)
3876  {
3877  LogHostError(hr);
3878  goto end;
3879  }
3880 
3881  continue;
3882  }
3883 
3884  // Register available frames to processor
3885  PaUtil_SetInputFrameCount(&stream->bufferProcessor, available);
3886 
3887  // Register host buffer pointer to processor
3888  PaUtil_SetInterleavedInputChannels(&stream->bufferProcessor, 0, wasapi_buffer, stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount);
3889 
3890  // Copy user data to host buffer (with conversion if applicable)
3891  processed = PaUtil_CopyInput(&stream->bufferProcessor, (void **)&user_buffer, frames);
3892  frames -= processed;
3893 
3894  // Save tail into buffer
3895  if ((frames == 0) && (available > processed))
3896  {
3897  UINT32 bytes_processed = processed * stream->in.wavex.Format.nBlockAlign;
3898  UINT32 frames_to_save = available - processed;
3899 
3900  PaUtil_WriteRingBuffer(stream->in.tailBuffer, wasapi_buffer + bytes_processed, frames_to_save);
3901  }
3902 
3903  // Release host buffer
3904  if ((hr = IAudioCaptureClient_ReleaseBuffer(stream->captureClient, available)) != S_OK)
3905  {
3906  LogHostError(hr);
3907  goto end;
3908  }
3909  }
3910 
3911 end:
3912 
3913  // Notify blocking op has ended
3914  SetEvent(stream->hBlockingOpStreamRD);
3915 
3916  return (hr != S_OK ? paUnanticipatedHostError : paNoError);
3917 }
3918 
3919 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3920 static PaError WriteStream( PaStream* s, const void *_buffer, unsigned long frames )
3921 {
3922  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
3923 
3924  //UINT32 frames;
3925  const BYTE *user_buffer = (const BYTE *)_buffer;
3926  BYTE *wasapi_buffer;
3927  HRESULT hr = S_OK;
3928  UINT32 i, available, sleep = 0;
3929  unsigned long processed;
3930  ThreadIdleScheduler sched;
3931 
3932  // validate
3933  if (!stream->running)
3934  return paStreamIsStopped;
3935  if (stream->renderClient == NULL)
3936  return paBadStreamPtr;
3937 
3938  // Notify blocking op has begun
3939  ResetEvent(stream->hBlockingOpStreamWR);
3940 
3941  // Use thread scheduling for 500 microseconds (emulated) when wait time for frames is less than
3942  // 1 milliseconds, emulation helps to normalize CPU consumption and avoids too busy waiting
3943  ThreadIdleScheduler_Setup(&sched, 1, 500/* microseconds */);
3944 
3945  // Make a local copy of the user buffer pointer(s), this is necessary
3946  // because PaUtil_CopyOutput() advances these pointers every time it is called
3947  if (!stream->bufferProcessor.userOutputIsInterleaved)
3948  {
3949  user_buffer = (const BYTE *)alloca(sizeof(const BYTE *) * stream->bufferProcessor.outputChannelCount);
3950  if (user_buffer == NULL)
3951  return paInsufficientMemory;
3952 
3953  for (i = 0; i < stream->bufferProcessor.outputChannelCount; ++i)
3954  ((const BYTE **)user_buffer)[i] = ((const BYTE **)_buffer)[i];
3955  }
3956 
3957  // Blocking (potentially, untill 'frames' are consumed) loop
3958  while (frames != 0)
3959  {
3960  // Check if blocking call must be interrupted
3961  if (WaitForSingleObject(stream->hCloseRequest, sleep) != WAIT_TIMEOUT)
3962  break;
3963 
3964  // Get frames available
3965  if ((hr = _PollGetOutputFramesAvailable(stream, &available)) != S_OK)
3966  {
3967  LogHostError(hr);
3968  goto end;
3969  }
3970 
3971  // Wait for more frames to become available
3972  if (available == 0)
3973  {
3974  UINT32 sleep_frames = (frames < stream->out.framesPerHostCallback ? frames : stream->out.framesPerHostCallback);
3975 
3976  sleep = GetFramesSleepTime(sleep_frames, stream->out.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec);
3977  sleep /= 2; // wait only for half of the buffer
3978 
3979  // Avoid busy waiting, schedule next 1 millesecond wait
3980  if (sleep == 0)
3981  sleep = ThreadIdleScheduler_NextSleep(&sched);
3982 
3983  continue;
3984  }
3985 
3986  // Keep in 'frmaes' range
3987  if (available > frames)
3988  available = frames;
3989 
3990  // Get pointer to host buffer
3991  if ((hr = IAudioRenderClient_GetBuffer(stream->renderClient, available, &wasapi_buffer)) != S_OK)
3992  {
3993  // Buffer size is too big, waiting
3994  if (hr == AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE)
3995  continue;
3996 
3997  LogHostError(hr);
3998  goto end;
3999  }
4000 
4001  // Keep waiting again (on Vista it was noticed that WASAPI could SOMETIMES return NULL pointer
4002  // to buffer without returning AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE instead)
4003  if (wasapi_buffer == NULL)
4004  continue;
4005 
4006  // Register available frames to processor
4007  PaUtil_SetOutputFrameCount(&stream->bufferProcessor, available);
4008 
4009  // Register host buffer pointer to processor
4010  PaUtil_SetInterleavedOutputChannels(&stream->bufferProcessor, 0, wasapi_buffer, stream->bufferProcessor.outputChannelCount);
4011 
4012  // Copy user data to host buffer (with conversion if applicable), this call will advance
4013  // pointer 'user_buffer' to consumed portion of data
4014  processed = PaUtil_CopyOutput(&stream->bufferProcessor, (const void **)&user_buffer, frames);
4015  frames -= processed;
4016 
4017  // Release host buffer
4018  if ((hr = IAudioRenderClient_ReleaseBuffer(stream->renderClient, available, 0)) != S_OK)
4019  {
4020  LogHostError(hr);
4021  goto end;
4022  }
4023  }
4024 
4025 end:
4026 
4027  // Notify blocking op has ended
4028  SetEvent(stream->hBlockingOpStreamWR);
4029 
4030  return (hr != S_OK ? paUnanticipatedHostError : paNoError);
4031 }
4032 
4033 unsigned long PaUtil_GetOutputFrameCount( PaUtilBufferProcessor* bp )
4034 {
4035  return bp->hostOutputFrameCount[0];
4036 }

4038 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4039 static signed long GetStreamReadAvailable( PaStream* s )
4040 {
4041  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
4042 
4043  HRESULT hr;
4044  UINT32 available = 0;
4045 
4046  // validate
4047  if (!stream->running)
4048  return paStreamIsStopped;
4049  if (stream->captureClient == NULL)
4050  return paBadStreamPtr;
4051 
4052  // available in hardware buffer
4053  if ((hr = _PollGetInputFramesAvailable(stream, &available)) != S_OK)
4054  {
4055  LogHostError(hr);
4056  return paUnanticipatedHostError;
4057  }
4058 
4059  // available in software tail buffer
4060  available += PaUtil_GetRingBufferReadAvailable(stream->in.tailBuffer);
4061

4065 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4066 static signed long GetStreamWriteAvailable( PaStream* s )
4067 {
4068  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)s;
4069  HRESULT hr;
4070  UINT32 available = 0;
4071 
4072  // validate
4073  if (!stream->running)
4074  return paStreamIsStopped;
4075  if (stream->renderClient == NULL)
4076  return paBadStreamPtr;
4077 
4078  if ((hr = _PollGetOutputFramesAvailable(stream, &available)) != S_OK)
4079  {
4080  LogHostError(hr);
4081  return paUnanticipatedHostError;
4082  }
4083

4088 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4089 static void WaspiHostProcessingLoop( void *inputBuffer, long inputFrames,
4090  void *outputBuffer, long outputFrames,
4091  void *userData )
4092 {
4093  PaWasapiStream *stream = (PaWasapiStream*)userData;
4094  PaStreamCallbackTimeInfo timeInfo = {0,0,0};
4095  PaStreamCallbackFlags flags = 0;
4096  int callbackResult;
4097  unsigned long framesProcessed;
4098  HRESULT hr;
4099  UINT32 pending;
4100 
4101  PaUtil_BeginCpuLoadMeasurement( &stream->cpuLoadMeasurer );
4102 
4103  /*
4104  Pa_GetStreamTime:
4105  - generate timing information
4106  - handle buffer slips
4107  */
4108  timeInfo.currentTime = PaUtil_GetTime();
4109  // Query input latency
4110  if (stream->in.clientProc != NULL)
4111  {
4112  PaTime pending_time;
4113  if ((hr = IAudioClient_GetCurrentPadding(stream->in.clientProc, &pending)) == S_OK)
4114  pending_time = (PaTime)pending / (PaTime)stream->in.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
4115  else
4116  pending_time = (PaTime)stream->in.latencySeconds;
4117 
4118  timeInfo.inputBufferAdcTime = timeInfo.currentTime + pending_time;
4119  }
4120  // Query output current latency
4121  if (stream->out.clientProc != NULL)
4122  {
4123  PaTime pending_time;
4124  if ((hr = IAudioClient_GetCurrentPadding(stream->out.clientProc, &pending)) == S_OK)
4125  pending_time = (PaTime)pending / (PaTime)stream->out.wavex.Format.nSamplesPerSec;
4126  else
4127  pending_time = (PaTime)stream->out.latencySeconds;
4128 
4129  timeInfo.outputBufferDacTime = timeInfo.currentTime + pending_time;
4130  }
4131 
4132  /*
4133  If you need to byte swap or shift inputBuffer to convert it into a
4134  portaudio format, do it here.
4135  */
4136 
4137  PaUtil_BeginBufferProcessing( &stream->bufferProcessor, &timeInfo, flags );
4138 
4139  /*
4140  depending on whether the host buffers are interleaved, non-interleaved
4141  or a mixture, you will want to call PaUtil_SetInterleaved*Channels(),
4142  PaUtil_SetNonInterleaved*Channel() or PaUtil_Set*Channel() here.
4143  */
4144 
4145  if (stream->bufferProcessor.inputChannelCount > 0)
4146  {
4147  PaUtil_SetInputFrameCount( &stream->bufferProcessor, inputFrames );
4148  PaUtil_SetInterleavedInputChannels( &stream->bufferProcessor,
4149  0, /* first channel of inputBuffer is channel 0 */
4150  inputBuffer,
4151  0 ); /* 0 - use inputChannelCount passed to init buffer processor */
4152  }
4153 
4154  if (stream->bufferProcessor.outputChannelCount > 0)
4155  {
4156  PaUtil_SetOutputFrameCount( &stream->bufferProcessor, outputFrames);
4157  PaUtil_SetInterleavedOutputChannels( &stream->bufferProcessor,
4158  0, /* first channel of outputBuffer is channel 0 */
4159  outputBuffer,
4160  0 ); /* 0 - use outputChannelCount passed to init buffer processor */
4161  }
4162 
4163  /* you must pass a valid value of callback result to PaUtil_EndBufferProcessing()
4164  in general you would pass paContinue for normal operation, and
4165  paComplete to drain the buffer processor's internal output buffer.
4166  You can check whether the buffer processor's output buffer is empty
4167  using PaUtil_IsBufferProcessorOuputEmpty( bufferProcessor )
4168  */
4169  callbackResult = paContinue;
4170  framesProcessed = PaUtil_EndBufferProcessing( &stream->bufferProcessor, &callbackResult );
4171 
4172  /*
4173  If you need to byte swap or shift outputBuffer to convert it to
4174  host format, do it here.
4175  */
4176 
4177  PaUtil_EndCpuLoadMeasurement( &stream->cpuLoadMeasurer, framesProcessed );
4178 
4179  if (callbackResult == paContinue)
4180  {
4181  /* nothing special to do */
4182  }
4183  else
4184  if (callbackResult == paAbort)
4185  {
4186  // stop stream
4187  SetEvent(stream->hCloseRequest);
4188  }
4189  else
4190  {
4191  // stop stream
4192  SetEvent(stream->hCloseRequest);
4193  }
4194 }

4236 {

4238  {
4239  NULL,
4240  "Audio",
4241  "Capture",
4242  "Distribution",

4244  "Playback",
4245  "Pro Audio",
4246  "Window Manager"
4247  };

4251  return paUnanticipatedHostError;

4276 // Described at:
4277 // http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd371387(v=VS.85).aspx
4278 
4279 PaError PaWasapi_GetJackCount(PaDeviceIndex nDevice, int *jcount)
4280 {
4281  PaError ret;
4282  HRESULT hr = S_OK;
4283  PaDeviceIndex index;
4284  IDeviceTopology *pDeviceTopology = NULL;
4285  IConnector *pConnFrom = NULL;
4286  IConnector *pConnTo = NULL;
4287  IPart *pPart = NULL;
4288  IKsJackDescription *pJackDesc = NULL;
4289  UINT jackCount = 0;
4290 
4291  PaWasapiHostApiRepresentation *paWasapi = _GetHostApi(&ret);
4292  if (paWasapi == NULL)
4293  return paNotInitialized;
4294 
4295  // Get device index.
4296  ret = PaUtil_DeviceIndexToHostApiDeviceIndex(&index, nDevice, &paWasapi->inheritedHostApiRep);
4297  if (ret != paNoError)
4298  return ret;
4299 
4300  // Validate index.
4301  if ((UINT32)index >= paWasapi->deviceCount)
4302  return paInvalidDevice;
4303 
4304  // Get the endpoint device's IDeviceTopology interface.
4305  hr = IMMDevice_Activate(paWasapi->devInfo[index].device, &pa_IID_IDeviceTopology,
4306  CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL, (void**)&pDeviceTopology);
4307  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4308 
4309  // The device topology for an endpoint device always contains just one connector (connector number 0).
4310  hr = IDeviceTopology_GetConnector(pDeviceTopology, 0, &pConnFrom);
4311  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4312 
4313  // Step across the connection to the jack on the adapter.
4314  hr = IConnector_GetConnectedTo(pConnFrom, &pConnTo);
4315  if (HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND) == hr)
4316  {
4317  // The adapter device is not currently active.
4318  hr = E_NOINTERFACE;
4319  }
4320  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4321 
4322  // Get the connector's IPart interface.
4323  hr = IConnector_QueryInterface(pConnTo, &pa_IID_IPart, (void**)&pPart);
4324  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4325 
4326  // Activate the connector's IKsJackDescription interface.
4327  hr = IPart_Activate(pPart, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, &pa_IID_IKsJackDescription, (void**)&pJackDesc);
4328  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4329 
4330  // Return jack count for this device.
4331  hr = IKsJackDescription_GetJackCount(pJackDesc, &jackCount);
4332  IF_FAILED_JUMP(hr, error);
4333 
4334  // Set.
4335  (*jcount) = jackCount;
4336 
4337  // Ok.
4338  ret = paNoError;
4339 
4340 error:
4341 
4342  SAFE_RELEASE(pDeviceTopology);
4343  SAFE_RELEASE(pConnFrom);
4344  SAFE_RELEASE(pConnTo);
4345  SAFE_RELEASE(pPart);
4346  SAFE_RELEASE(pJackDesc);
4347 
4348  LogHostError(hr);
4349  return paNoError;
4350 }

4437 PaError PaWasapi_GetJackDescription(PaDeviceIndex nDevice, int jindex, PaWasapiJackDescription *pJackDescription)
4438 {

4450  if (paWasapi == NULL)
4451  return paNotInitialized;
4452

4454  ret = PaUtil_DeviceIndexToHostApiDeviceIndex(&index, nDevice, &paWasapi->inheritedHostApiRep);
4455  if (ret != paNoError)
4456  return ret;
4457

4460  return paInvalidDevice;

4464  CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, NULL, (void**)&pDeviceTopology);

4468  hr = IDeviceTopology_GetConnector(pDeviceTopology, 0, &pConnFrom);

4473  if (HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND) == hr)
4474  {
4475  // The adapter device is not currently active.
4476  hr = E_NOINTERFACE;

4516 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4517 HRESULT _PollGetOutputFramesAvailable(PaWasapiStream *stream, UINT32 *available)
4518 {
4519  HRESULT hr;
4520  UINT32 frames = stream->out.framesPerHostCallback,
4521  padding = 0;
4522 
4523  (*available) = 0;
4524 
4525  // get read position
4526  if ((hr = IAudioClient_GetCurrentPadding(stream->out.clientProc, &padding)) != S_OK)
4527  return LogHostError(hr);
4528 
4529  // get available
4530  frames -= padding;
4531 
4532  // set
4533  (*available) = frames;
4534  return hr;
4535 }

4538 HRESULT _PollGetInputFramesAvailable(PaWasapiStream *stream, UINT32 *available)
4539 {
4540  HRESULT hr;
4541 
4542  (*available) = 0;
4543 
4544  // GetCurrentPadding() has opposite meaning to Output stream

4546  return LogHostError(hr);

4548  return hr;

4551 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4552 HRESULT ProcessOutputBuffer(PaWasapiStream *stream, PaWasapiHostProcessor *processor, UINT32 frames)
4553 {
4554  HRESULT hr;
4555  BYTE *data = NULL;
4556 
4557  // Get buffer
4558  if ((hr = IAudioRenderClient_GetBuffer(stream->renderClient, frames, &data)) != S_OK)
4559  {
4560  if (stream->out.shareMode == AUDCLNT_SHAREMODE_SHARED)
4561  {
4562  // Using GetCurrentPadding to overcome AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE in
4563  // shared mode results in no sound in Event-driven mode (MSDN does not
4564  // document this, or is it WASAPI bug?), thus we better
4565  // try to acquire buffer next time when GetBuffer allows to do so.
4566 #if 0
4567  // Get Read position
4568  UINT32 padding = 0;
4569  hr = IAudioClient_GetCurrentPadding(stream->out.clientProc, &padding);
4570  if (hr != S_OK)
4571  return LogHostError(hr);
4572 
4573  // Get frames to write
4574  frames -= padding;
4575  if (frames == 0)
4576  return S_OK;
4577 
4578  if ((hr = IAudioRenderClient_GetBuffer(stream->renderClient, frames, &data)) != S_OK)
4579  return LogHostError(hr);
4580 #else
4581  if (hr == AUDCLNT_E_BUFFER_TOO_LARGE)
4582  return S_OK; // be silent in shared mode, try again next time
4583 #endif
4584  }
4585  else
4586  return LogHostError(hr);
4587  }
4588 
4589  // Process data
4590  if (stream->out.monoMixer != NULL)
4591  {
4592  // expand buffer
4593  UINT32 mono_frames_size = frames * (stream->out.wavex.Format.wBitsPerSample / 8);
4594  if (mono_frames_size > stream->out.monoBufferSize)
4595  stream->out.monoBuffer = PaWasapi_ReallocateMemory(stream->out.monoBuffer, (stream->out.monoBufferSize = mono_frames_size));
4596 
4597  // process
4598  processor[S_OUTPUT].processor(NULL, 0, (BYTE *)stream->out.monoBuffer, frames, processor[S_OUTPUT].userData);
4599 
4600  // mix 1 to 2 channels
4601  stream->out.monoMixer(data, stream->out.monoBuffer, frames);
4602  }
4603  else
4604  {
4605  processor[S_OUTPUT].processor(NULL, 0, data, frames, processor[S_OUTPUT].userData);
4606  }
4607 
4608  // Release buffer
4609  if ((hr = IAudioRenderClient_ReleaseBuffer(stream->renderClient, frames, 0)) != S_OK)
4610  LogHostError(hr);
4611 
4612  return hr;
4613 }
